input_schema.name: Mode
input_schema.description: What should the actor do
input_schema.value_options:
"append": string
"replace": string
"modify": string
"read": string
"load backup": string

input_schema.name: Spreadsheet id
input_schema.description: Id of the spreadsheet from where the old data will be loaded

input_schema.name: Public spreadsheet (read-only)
input_schema.description: If checked, you don't need to authorize. You have to publish your spreadsheet and it works only in read mode

input_schema.name: Dataset ID
input_schema.description: Dataset or crawler execution id where the new data will be loaded from

input_schema.name: Raw data
input_schema.description: Raw data JSON array. Can be array of arrays for direct row import or arrays of objects.

input_schema.name: Limit items
input_schema.description: Number of items to take from the dataset. The default is 250000.

input_schema.name: Offset items
input_schema.description: Number of items to skip from the dataset. Default is 0.

input_schema.name: Deduplicate by field
input_schema.description: Items will be deduplicated by a value of this field. Cannot be used together with 'Deduplicate by equality' or 'Transform function'.

input_schema.name: Deduplicate by equality
input_schema.description: Items will be deduplicated if they are the same. Cannot be used together with 'Deduplicate by field' or 'Transform function'.

input_schema.name: Transform function
input_schema.description: Custom function that will take new items and old items arrays as parameters and produces final array that will be imported. Cannot be used together with 'Deduplicate by equality' or 'Deduplicate by field'

input_schema.name: Range
input_schema.description: Range of the spreadsheet in A1 notation where the actor should operate. Default is the first sheet.

input_schema.name: Columns order
input_schema.description: Array of keys. First sorts the columns by provided keys. The rest is sorted alphabetically.

input_schema.name: Keep column order from sheet
input_schema.description: If true, keeps the order of columns as they are in the sheet. If there is no sheet data yet, this does nothing.

input_schema.name: Google OAuth tokens store
input_schema.description: Key-value store where your Google OAuth tokens will be stored so you don't have to authorize every time again. By default it is google-oauth-tokens

input_schema.name: Create backup
input_schema.description: Old rows from your spreadsheet will be saved to the default key-value store before importing new rows.

input_schema.name: Backup store id
input_schema.description: Id of the key-value store where the backup you want to load is located. Can pnly be used if mode is 'load-backup'

input_schema.name: Google Developer Console credentials
input_schema.description: If you want to use this actor locally or with your own version, you have to provide your own crednetials. Check actor readme for more information.

input_schema.name: Website/category URLs
input_schema.description: These could be the main page URL or any category/subpage URL, e.g. https://www.bbc.com/. Article pages are detected and crawled from these. If you prefer to use direct article URLs, use articleUrls input instead

input_schema.name: Article URLs
input_schema.description: These are direct URLs for the articles to be extracted, e.g. https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-62836057. No extra pages are crawled from article pages.

input_schema.name: Only new articles (only for small runs)
input_schema.description: This option is only viable for smaller runs. If you plan to use this on a large scale, use the 'Only new articles (saved per domain)' option below instead. If this function is selected, the extractor will only scrape new articles each time you run it. (Scraped URLs are saved in a dataset named articles-state, and are compared with new ones.)

input_schema.name: Only new articles (saved per domain, preferable)
input_schema.description: If this function is selected, the extractor will only scrape only new articles each time you run it. (Scraped articles are saved in one dataset, named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain', per each domain, and compared with new ones.)

input_schema.name: Only inside domain articles
input_schema.description: If this function is selected, the extractor will only scrape articles that are on the domain from where they are linked. If the domain presents links to articles on different domains, those articles will not be scraped, e.g. https://www.bbc.com/ vs. https://www.bbc.co.uk/.

input_schema.name: Enqueue articles from articles
input_schema.description: Normally, the scraper only extracts articles from category pages. This option allows the scraper to also extract articles linked within articles.

input_schema.name: Crawl whole subdomain (same base as Start URL)
input_schema.description: Automatically enqueue categories and articles from whole subdomain with the same path. E.g. if Start URL is https://apify.com/store, it will enqueue all pages starting with https://apify.com/store

input_schema.name: Limit articles to only from subdomain
input_schema.description: Only loads articles which URL begins with the same path as Start URL. E.g. if Start URL is https://apify.com/store, it will only load articles starting with https://apify.com/store

input_schema.name: Find articles in sitemaps (caution)
input_schema.description: We recommend using Sitemap URLs instead. If this function is selected, the extractor will scan different sitemaps from the initial article URL. Keep in mind that this option can lead to the loading of a huge amount of (sometimes old) articles, in which case the time and cost of the scrape will increase.

input_schema.name: Sitemap URLs (safer)
input_schema.description: You can provide selected sitemap URLs that include the articles you need to extract.

input_schema.name: Save full HTML
input_schema.description: If this function is selected, the scraper will save the full HTML of the article page, but this will make the data less readable.

input_schema.name: Save full HTML (only as link to it)
input_schema.description: If this function is selected, the scraper will save the full HTML of the article page as a URL to keep the dataset clean and small.

input_schema.name: Save screenshots of article pages (browser only)
input_schema.description: Stores a screenshot for each article page to Key-Value Store and provides that as screenshotUrl. Useful for debugging.

input_schema.name: Use Googlebot headers
input_schema.description: This option will allow you to bypass protection and paywalls on some websites. Use with caution as it might lead to getting blocked.

input_schema.name: Minimum words
input_schema.description: The article needs to contain at least this number of words to be extracted

input_schema.name: Extract articles from [date]
input_schema.description: Only articles from this day on will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

input_schema.name: Only articles for last X days
input_schema.description: Only get posts that were published in the last X days from time the scraping starts. Use either this or the absolute date.

input_schema.name: Must have date
input_schema.description: If checked, the article must have a date of release to be extracted.

input_schema.name: Is the URL an article?
input_schema.description: Here you can input JSON settings to define what URLs should be considered articles by the scraper. If any of them is true, then the link will be opened and the article extracted.

input_schema.name: Pseudo URLs
input_schema.description: This function can be used to enqueue more pages, i.e. include more links like pagination or categories. This doesn't work for articles, as they are recognized by the recognition system.

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description: You can limit the tags whose links will be enqueued. This field is empty by default. Add a.some-class to activate it

input_schema.name: Max depth
input_schema.description: Maximum depth of crawling, i.e. how many times the scraper picks up a link to other webpages. Level 0 refers to the start URLs, 1 are the first level links, and so on. This is only valid for pseudo URLs

input_schema.name: Max pages per crawl
input_schema.description: Maximum number of total pages crawled. It includes the home page, pagination pages, invalid articles, and so on. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Max articles per crawl
input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Max articles per start URL
input_schema.description: Maximum number of articles scraped per start URL.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: You can limit the speed of the scraper to avoid getting blocked.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Proxy configuration

input_schema.name: Override proxy group
input_schema.description: If you want to override the default proxy group, you can specify it here. This is useful if you want to use a different proxy group for each crawler.

input_schema.name: Use browser (Puppeteer)
input_schema.description: This option is more expensive, but it allows you to evaluate JavaScript and wait for dynamically loaded data.

input_schema.name: Wait on each page (ms)
input_schema.description: How many milliseconds to wait on each page before extracting data

input_schema.name: Wait for selector on each category page
input_schema.description: For what selector to wait on each page before extracting data

input_schema.name: Wait for selector on each article page
input_schema.description: For what selector to wait on each page before extracting data

input_schema.name: Scroll to bottom of the page (infinite scroll)
input_schema.description: Scroll to the botton of the page, loading dynamic articles.

input_schema.name: Scroll to bottom button selector
input_schema.description: CSS selector for a button to load more articles

input_schema.name: Scroll to bottom max seconds
input_schema.description: Limit for how long the scrolling can run so it does no go infinite.

input_schema.name: Extend output function
input_schema.description: This function allows you to merge your custom extraction with the default one. You can only return an object from this function. This object will be merged/overwritten with the default output for each article.

input_schema.name: Limit CU consumption
input_schema.description: The scraper will stop running after reaching this number of compute units.

input_schema.name: Emails address for notifications
input_schema.description: Notifications will be sent to these email addresses.

input_schema.name: Notify after [number] CUs
input_schema.description: The scraper will send notifications to the provided email when it reaches this number of CUs.

input_schema.name: Notify every [number] CUs
input_schema.description: The scraper will send notifications to the provided email every time this number of CUs is reached since the last notification.

input_schema.name: Add Instagram URLs you want to scrape
input_schema.description: Add one or more Instagram URLs to scrape.

input_schema.name: What do you want to scrape from each page?
input_schema.description: Decide what you want to scrape from each Instagram page URL or search result. Tip: You need to select the correct parent page based on URL, e.g. comments can only be scraped from posts, not from profiles.

input_schema.name: Max items (max 50 comments per post)
input_schema.description: How many posts or comments you want to scrape from each Instagram URL or found page. If you set this to 1, you will get a single post from each page. This is ignored when "Details" type is specified. Note that, if you search via hashtags or place, each found page will have this limit applied separately.

input_schema.name: Add metadata
input_schema.description: Only for feed items - add data source to results, i.e. for profile posts metadata is profile, for tag posts metadata is hashtag

input_schema.name: Tagged posts
input_schema.description: Get the tagged posts for each profile

input_schema.name: Search
input_schema.description:
Provide a search query which will be used to search Instagram for profiles, hashtags, or places.

This field is optional, but you need to either use this field or provide Instagram URLs.

input_schema.name: Search type
input_schema.description: What type of pages to search (you can search hashtags, profiles and places)

input_schema.name: Search results limit
input_schema.description: How many search results (e.g. hashtags, profiles, or pages) should be processed. If you set this to 1 (e.g. 'coffee', you will just scrape a single search term. If you set it to 3, you will scrape three search terms (e.g. 'coffee', 'coffeetime', 'coffeelover'), and so on. Maximum that Instagram displays is 55.

input_schema.name: Newer than
input_schema.description: Scrapes post from the provided date to the present day (or date set in 'Older than'). The date should be in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative time, e.g. today.

input_schema.name: Facebook URLs
input_schema.description: Enter a valid Facebook page URL, e.g. https://www.facebook.com/humansofnewyork/. Note that you can only scrape public pages with this actor, not personal profiles.

input_schema.name: Results amount
input_schema.description: If this limit is not set only initial page of results returned

input_schema.name: Search Terms
input_schema.description: Enter your search queries here. For example search queries, refer to https://github.com/igorbrigadir/twitter-advanced-search.

input_schema.name: Max Tweets Per Query/Profile/URL
input_schema.description: Set the maximum number of tweets to scrape per query, profile, or URL. For instance, if you set a maximum of 50 for 3 search terms, the total tweet limit will be 150.

input_schema.name: Overall Maximum Tweets
input_schema.description: Set an overall limit for the number of tweets to scrape across all threads. Once this limit is reached, all threads will stop. This may lead to unequal numbers of tweets collected from each query. To ensure equal distribution, consider using the 'Max Tweets Per Input' setting.

input_schema.name: Tweet Language
input_schema.description: Choose a specific language to filter tweets. If left as 'Any', tweets in all languages will be included.

input_schema.name: Specific Twitter Profiles
input_schema.description: Provide a list of Twitter profiles to scrape. The profiles should be written as 'username' or '@username'

input_schema.name: Use Experimental Profile Scraper
input_schema.description: Activates an experimental profile scraper that uses the user timeline instead of search and should have a few months of history (can go back a few months rather than 10 days) but doesn't work with filtering, except tweet only will only return the user's tweets and replies.

input_schema.name: Specific Tweet URLs
input_schema.description: List the twitter search URLs you want to scape such as 'https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665' if your url contains more such as a cursor like 'https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665?s=20' only the tweets on the current screen will be loaded.

input_schema.name: Info to collect
input_schema.description: Options to either collect each tweet with all of its replies, only each tweet, or only the replies.
input_schema.value_options:
"user info and replying info": string
"only replying info": string
"only user info": string

input_schema.name: Twitter Search URLs
input_schema.description: List the full links to tweets you want to scape such as 'https://twitter.com/search?q=((MadMaxFuryRoad%20OR%20MadMax%20OR%20%22FuryRoad%22%20OR%20%22GeorgeMiller%22%20OR%20GeorgeMiller%20OR%20TomHardy%20OR%20%22CharlizeTheron%22%20OR%20CharlizeTheron)%20AND%20(Film%20OR%20Movie%20OR%20Review))&src=typed_query&f=top' if your url contains more such as a cursor only the tweets on the current screen will be loaded.

input_schema.name: Only tweets (no retweets, replies or quotes)
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets that are not retweets, replies, or quotes.

input_schema.name: Only verified users
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets from verified users

input_schema.name: Only verified users with Twitter Blue
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets from verified users with Twitter Blue

input_schema.name: Only retweets made using the retweet button
input_schema.description: Only retweets created using the retweet button. Works well combined with from: to show only retweets. Only works within the last 7-10 days or so.

input_schema.name: Only retweets or quoted tweets
input_schema.description: Old style retweets ('RT') + quoted tweets

input_schema.name: Only replies
input_schema.description: Returns tweets that are a reply to another Tweet

input_schema.name: Contain Quote Tweets
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return Quote Tweets

input_schema.name: Has some engagement
input_schema.description: Has some engagement (replies, favorites, retweets). Can be negated to find tweets with no engagement.

input_schema.name: All media types
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with any media type

input_schema.name: All images
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with any image

input_schema.name: All video types
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with any video type, including native Twitter video and external sources such as Youtube.

input_schema.name: Native Twitter images
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with native Twitter images (pic.twitter.com links)

input_schema.name: Only safe tweets
input_schema.description: Filters out unsafe tweets

input_schema.name: Author
input_schema.description: Written by a particular user. Useful if you want to use multiple custom queries for a single user.'

input_schema.name: In reply to
input_schema.description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

input_schema.name: Mentioning
input_schema.description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

input_schema.name: Geotagged near
input_schema.description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

input_schema.name: Within Radius
input_schema.description: Within specific radius of the 'near' operator, to apply a limit. Can use km or mi. e.g. fire near:san-francisco within:10km

input_schema.name: Geocode
input_schema.description: To get tweets around a specific location, use geocode:lat,long,radius. E.g., to get tweets 10km around twitters hq, use geocode:37.7764685,-122.4172004,10km

input_schema.name: Place Object ID
input_schema.description: Search tweets by Place Object ID eg: USA Place ID is 96683cc9126741d1

input_schema.name: Minimum Retweets
input_schema.description: Specify minimum number of Retweets a tweet should have to be included.

input_schema.name: Minimum Favorites
input_schema.description: Specify minimum number of favorites a tweet should have to be included.

input_schema.name: Minimum Replies
input_schema.description: Specify minimum number of replies a tweet should have to be included.

input_schema.name: Start
input_schema.description: Specify the earliest date (inclusive) from which to start scraping tweets. The date should be in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

input_schema.name: End
input_schema.description: Specify the latest date (exclusive) until which to scrape tweets. The date should be in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

input_schema.name: Maximum Attempts
input_schema.description: Specify the maximum number of attempts to be made if a scrape operation fails. After reaching this limit, the failed operation will be skipped.

input_schema.name: Manually Set Number of Threads/Workers (if blank it will automatically optimize based on memory)
input_schema.description: Overrides the number of threads/workers automatically optimized for your memory amount. Could be useful for troubleshooting.

input_schema.name: Enter URLs of Amazon products
input_schema.description: Enter the URL or URLs of the Amazon products you want to scrape. (E.g., https://www.amazon.com/Sceptre-E248W-19203R-Monitor-Speakers-Metallic/dp/B0773ZY26F). Just click +Add to enter additional URLs.

input_schema.name: Max reviews per product (limited to 100 for each star rating - up to 500 reviews for a single product)
input_schema.description: Enter the maximum number of reviews to be scraped. Leave this blank if you want to extract all reviews.

input_schema.name: Include personal information
input_schema.description: Personal data such as name, id or profile image is protected by GDPR in the European Union and by other regulations around the world. You should not scrape personal data unless you have a legitimate reason to do so. Read more.

input_schema.name: Reviews sort
input_schema.description: Select by which criteria the reviews should be sorted. Amazon's default is 'Top reviews'.

input_schema.name: Filter by rating
input_schema.description: Select the rating by which the reviews should be filtered. Amazon's default is 'All stars'.
input_schema.value_options:
"allStars": string
"fiveStar": string
"fourStar": string
"threeStar": string
"twoStar": string
"oneStar": string
"positive": string
"critical": string

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: You can set proxy groups from specific countries. Amazon shows you the products that can be shipped to your address based on the proxy you use. You don't need to worry about it if globally shipped products are enough for you.

input_schema.name: Extended output function
input_schema.description: Enter function that takes a JQuery handle ($) as an argument and returns custom extracted data. This data will be merged with the default output.

input_schema.name: Profiles or Tweets URLs. (Add at least 50 for full speed scraping!)
Twitter usernames, e.g. elonmusk or @elonmusk. (Add at least 50 for full speed scraping!)
(Temporarily not working!) Users search queries, e.g. elon musk. (Add at least 50 for full speed scraping!)
input_schema.description: A list of search queries for Twitter users. The scraper will scrape the tweets of the users returned by the search query.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of tweets (per profile or url). Limited to ~800 per profile without replies and ~3200 with replies.
input_schema.description: By setting this to 0, it will scrape only the profile info (for profiles only)

input_schema.name: (New) Replies depth (Read the description!) (Keep empty for old behavior!)
input_schema.description: How many levels of replies should be scraped. 0 means no replies, 1 means the tweet and its replies, 2 means the tweet, its replies and the replies of the replies, etc.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of profiles per (only for Users search queries)
input_schema.description: This value lets you set the maximum number of profiles to retrieve per search query (for "Users search queries")

input_schema.name: Tweets & Replies (for profiles only)
input_schema.description: Scrape tweets and replies to tweets (enabling this increases the number of tweets per profile to ~3200), e.g. https://twitter.com/elonmusk/with_replies

input_schema.name: Include the profile user info in every tweet result
input_schema.description: This will add the profile user info to every tweet result. This is useful if you want to scrape tweets from multiple profiles and want to know which profile each tweet belongs to.

input_schema.name: (New) Include user id in every tweet result
input_schema.description: This will add the profile user id to every tweet result. This is useful if you want to scrape tweets from multiple profiles and want to know which profile each tweet belongs to.

input_schema.name: Tweets newer than (since)
input_schema.description: This lets you specify the oldest date of tweets to extract, format YYYY-MM-DD. You can also use relative dates such as '1 month' or '2 days' instead of absolute dates such as '2020-02-29'.

input_schema.name: Music URL(s)
input_schema.description: Music URL(s) to scrape videos using them, e.g. https://www.tiktok.com/music/Oh-No-Instrumental-6889520563052645121. You can also use the IDs only, e.g. Oh-No-Instrumental-6889520563052645121.

input_schema.name: Max results
input_schema.description: The number of results that will be scraped from every hashtag and profile.

input_schema.name: Should download videos
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video files. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download video covers (thumbnails)
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video cover images (i.e. thumbnails). Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download slideshow images
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok slideshow images. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Video Download Key-Value Store ID or Name
input_schema.description:
Name (or ID) of the Key Value Store where the videos and other media like thumbnails will be stored. Omit to store in the default one. Using this option will provide a named Key-Value store can help bypass data retention and store the content forever until the store is manually deleted.

The Key-Value store's name can consist of a versatile combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens, all without any spaces.

input_schema.name: Disable querying author stats if missing
input_schema.description: Sometimes Tiktok's API will not return author stats (their hearts, follower count etc) for profile/hashtag/sound pages, so an additional query will be needed. This will slow the scraper down

input_schema.name: Disable boosting with cheerio for small result count
input_schema.description: If the requested number of posts is small, the Cheerio crawler (much faster) will be used. If for some reason you need to disable this, turn on this option

input_schema.name: Hashtag(s) to scrape from TikTok
input_schema.description: Just add TikTok hashtags and the scraper will collect information about users, followers, likes, and more.

input_schema.name: Number of results for one search
input_schema.description: The number of results that will be scraped from every hashtag and profile. With this free version you can scrape maximum 20 videos in one go.

input_schema.name: Profile(s)
input_schema.description: Add the name of user you want to scrape.

input_schema.name: Direct URL(s) for scraping specific video(s)
input_schema.description: Add the URLs of posted videos you want to scrape. You can enter URLs one by one, or you can upload or link to a text file.

input_schema.name: Should download videos
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video files. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download video covers (thumbnails)
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video cover images (i.e. thumbnails). Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download slideshow images
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok slideshow images. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Video Download Key-Value Store ID or Name
input_schema.description:
Name (or ID) of the Key Value Store where the videos and other media like thumbnails will be stored. Omit to store in the default one. Using this option will provide a named Key-Value store can help bypass data retention and store the content forever until the store is manually deleted.

The Key-Value store's name can consist of a versatile combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens, all without any spaces.

input_schema.name: Disable querying author stats if missing
input_schema.description: Sometimes Tiktok's API will not return author stats (their hearts, follower count etc) for profile/hashtag/sound pages, so an additional query will be needed. This will slow the scraper down

input_schema.name: Disable boosting with cheerio for small result count
input_schema.description: If the requested number of posts is small, the Cheerio crawler (much faster) will be used. If for some reason you need to disable this, turn on this option

input_schema.name: URLs to check
input_schema.description:
A static list of URLs to check for captchas. To be able to add new URLs on the fly, enable the Use request queue option.

For details, see Start URLs in README.

input_schema.name: Proxy Configuration
input_schema.description:
Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

For details, see Proxy configuration in README.

input_schema.name: Cheerio
input_schema.description: Crawl with Cheerio

input_schema.name: Puppeteer
input_schema.description: Crawl with Puppeteer

input_schema.name: Playwright
input_schema.description: Crawl with Playwright

input_schema.name: Enabled
input_schema.description: Will save HTML for Cheerio and HTML + screenshot for Puppeteer/Playwright

input_schema.name: Enqueue any URL on domain (no need for link selector or pseudo URLs)
input_schema.description: Will enqueue any URLs on the domain

input_schema.name: Link Selector
input_schema.description:
A CSS selector saying which links on the page (<a> elements with href attribute) shall be followed and added to the request queue. This setting only applies if Use request queue is enabled. To filter the links added to the queue, use the Pseudo-URLs setting.

If Link selector is empty, the page links are ignored.

For details, see Link selector in README.

input_schema.name: Pseudo-URLs
input_schema.description:
Specifies what kind of URLs found by Link selector should be added to the request queue. A pseudo-URL is a URL with regular expressions enclosed in [] brackets, e.g. http://www.example.com/[.*]. This setting only applies if the Use request queue option is enabled.

If Pseudo-URLs are omitted, the actor enqueues all links matched by the Link selector.

For details, see Pseudo-URLs in README.

input_schema.name: Repeat checks on provided URLs
input_schema.description: Will access each URL multiple times. Useful to test the same URL or bypass blocking of the first page.

input_schema.name: Max number of pages checked per domain
input_schema.description:
The maximum number of pages that the checker will load. The checker will stop when this limit is reached. It's always a good idea to set this limit in order to prevent excess platform usage for misconfigured scrapers. Note that the actual number of pages loaded might be slightly higher than this value.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

input_schema.name: Maximum concurrent pages checked per domain
input_schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of pages that can be processed by the checker in parallel for one domain. The checker automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. This option enables you to set an upper limit, for example to reduce the load on a target website.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of concurrent domains checked
input_schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of domains that should be checked at a time. This setting is relevant when passing in more than one URL to check.

input_schema.name: Retire browser instance after request count
input_schema.description: How often will the browser itself rotate. Pick a higher number for smaller consumption, pick a lower number to rotate (test) more proxies.

input_schema.name: Navigation timeout (seconds)
input_schema.description: Specifies the maximum time in seconds the request will wait for the page to load. If the page is not loaded within this time, the browser will throw an error and the page will be marked as failed.

input_schema.name: Headfull browser (XVFB)
input_schema.description: Only works for Puppeteer type!

input_schema.name: Use Chrome
input_schema.description: Only works for Puppeteer type! Be careful that Chrome is not guaranteed to work with Puppeteer.

input_schema.name: Wait for
input_schema.description: Only works for Puppeteer type. Will wait on each page. You can provide number in ms or a selector.

input_schema.name: Memory
input_schema.description: Must be power of 2 between 128 and 32768.

input_schema.name: Facebook URLs
input_schema.description: Valid facebook URL

input_schema.name: Maximum number of results
input_schema.description: If this limit is not set only initial page of results returned

input_schema.name: Direct URL(s) for scraping specific video(s)
input_schema.description: Add the URLs of posted videos you want to scrape. You can enter URLs one by one, or you can edit it in bulk.

input_schema.name: Max comments per post (over 500 can be slow)
input_schema.description: The number of comments that will be scraped from every scraped result. This can potentially scrape all comments, but it can also be slow for thousands per post.

input_schema.name: Max replies per comment (slow)
input_schema.description: How many (at most) replies you want from a comment. NOTE: it is currently not guaranteed that the scraper will manage to scrape ALL the desired replies. By default no replies are scraped.

input_schema.name: Facebook URLs
input_schema.description: Valid facebook URL

input_schema.name: Results amount
input_schema.description: If this limit is not set only initial page of results returned

input_schema.name: Search (What and/or where)
input_schema.description: Search you want to use to discover new events. You can provide search for topics, such as 'Sport', or for places, such as 'New York', or combine them 'Sport New York'.

input_schema.name: Or use direct URLs instead of Search
input_schema.description: URLs to start with. You can provide URLs of event details here or search/explore URLs, e.g. 'https://www.facebook.com/events/1023978871819924' or 'https://www.facebook.com/events/search/?q=Party' or 'https://www.facebook.com/events/explore/fr-paris/110774245616525' or 'https://www.facebook.com/events/search?q=Comedy&sde=AbrQ9KopLfqYT7heXVVCxznkZYxRr9hU1JA4cdLbJhjgs56yyeHW3e833A9dGP1WlEHOyagjWyFL9Y79gw-Ko1iVuJCILVkpVsHkmSbBFb3SEA&%3D'.

input_schema.name: Max Events
input_schema.description: Maximum number of events you want to extract data for. If you leave this field empty, the number of events won't be limited.

input_schema.name: Direct video URLs
input_schema.description: Enter a link to a specific Youtube video YouTube video. You can also import a CSV file or Google Sheet with a list of URLs.

input_schema.name: Maximum comments
input_schema.description: Limit the number of comments you want to scrape per video. Input 0 or leave the field empty to not scrape any comments.

input_schema.name: Name(s) of the channel
input_schema.description: Enter a link to a channel.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of shorts
input_schema.description: Limit the number of Shorts videos you want to crawl from the channel.

input_schema.name: Websites
input_schema.description: Similarweb websites to scrape. Enter domains.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Hotel URLs
input_schema.description: URLs of hotels to scrape reviews from. If you add any userData, it will be included in each review for given hotel under the key customData

input_schema.name: Maximum reviews per hotel
input_schema.description: Maximum number of reviews to scrape per hotel

input_schema.name: Sort reviews by
input_schema.description: Review attribute by which the reviews will be ordered

input_schema.name: Review scores filter
input_schema.description: Filter reviews by their score, as shown on Booking.com

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: A static list of URLs to scrape.

input_schema.name: Max crawling depth
input_schema.description: Specifies how many links away from the Start URLs the scraper will descend. Note that pages added using context.request_queue in Page function are not subject to the maximum depth constraint.

input_schema.name: Request timeout
input_schema.description: The maximum duration (in seconds) for the request to complete before timing out. The timeout value is passed to the httpx.AsyncClient object.

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description:
A CSS selector stating which links on the page (<a> elements with href attribute) shall be followed and added to the request queue. To filter the links added to the queue, use the Link patterns field.

If the Link selector is empty, the page links are ignored. Of course, you can work with the page links and the request queue in the Page function as well.

input_schema.name: Link patterns
input_schema.description: Link patterns (regular expressions) to match links in the page that you want to enqueue. Combine with Link selector to tell the scraper where to find links. Omitting the link patterns will cause the scraper to enqueue all links matched by the Link selector.

input_schema.name: Page function
input_schema.description: A Python function, that is executed for every page. Use it to scrape data from the page, perform actions or add new URLs to the request queue. The page function has its own naming scope and you can import any installed modules. Typically you would want to obtain the data from the context.soup object and return them. Identifier page_function can't be changed. For more information about the context object you get into the page_function check the github.com/apify/actor-beautifulsoup-scraper#context. Asynchronous functions are supported.

input_schema.name: BeautifulSoup features
input_schema.description: The value of BeautifulSoup features argument. From BeautifulSoup docs: Desirable features of the parser to be used. This may be the name of a specific parser ("lxml", "lxml-xml", "html.parser", or "html5lib") or it may be the type of markup to be used ("html", "html5", "xml"). It's recommended that you name a specific parser, so that Beautiful Soup gives you the same results across platforms and virtual environments.

input_schema.name: BeautifulSoup from_encoding
input_schema.description: The value of BeautifulSoup from_encoding argument. From BeautifulSoup docs: A string indicating the encoding of the document to be parsed. Pass this in if Beautiful Soup is guessing wrongly about the document's encoding.

input_schema.name: BeautifulSoup exclude_encodings
input_schema.description: The value of BeautifulSoup exclude_encodings argument. From BeautifulSoup docs: A list of strings indicating encodings known to be wrong. Pass this in if you don't know the document's encoding but you know Beautiful Soup's guess is wrong.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

input_schema.name: Home detail URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to scrape - should be in format https://www.zillow.com/homedetails/Address/12345678_zpid/

input_schema.name: Status of properties in Start URLs
input_schema.description: Since Zillow uses different methods to fetch properties for sale, for rent and sold, the Actor needs to know the status of the properties in Start URLs. If you this is provided incorrectly, the Actor will figure out the correct status and use it, but it will require additional requests to Zillow.

input_schema.name: Dataset ID with search scraper results
input_schema.description: For easy integration, this actor can use output of these Zillow search scrapers to scrape more details: Zillow ZIP Code Search Scraper.

input_schema.name: Debug Log
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor will log very detailed info into the output.

input_schema.name: Zip Codes
input_schema.description: List of zip codes for searching properties

input_schema.name: Minimum Price
input_schema.description: Minimum price of property (monthly price for rental)

input_schema.name: Maximum Price
input_schema.description: Maximum price of property (monthly price for rental)

input_schema.description: Include properties in For Sale results listed as 'Coming Soon'

input_schema.name: Days on Zillow
input_schema.description: Number of days a property has been listed on Zillow (if searching for Recently Sold, then this is the number of days since the property was sold)

input_schema.name: Search type
input_schema.description: What type of pages to search (you can search hashtags, profiles and places)

input_schema.name: Search results limit
input_schema.description: How many search results (e.g. hashtags, profiles, or pages) should be processed. If you set this to 1 (e.g. 'coffee', you will just scrape a single search term. If you set it to 3, you will scrape three search terms (e.g. 'coffee', 'coffeetime', 'coffeelover'), and so on. Maximum that Instagram displays is 55.

input_schema.name: Newer than
input_schema.description: Scrapes post from the provided date to the present day (or date set in 'Older than'). The date should be in YYYY-MM-DD format or relative time, e.g. today.

input_schema.name: Direct URLs
input_schema.description: Enter a link to a channel. You can also import a CSV file or Google Sheet with a list of URLs.

input_schema.name: Maximum videos
input_schema.description: Limit the number of regular videos (not streams, not shorts) you want to get from one channel. If you use several urls on the input you will get this number for each channel.

input_schema.name: Maximum shorts
input_schema.description: Limit the number of Shorts videos you want to get from the channel.

input_schema.name: Maximum streams
input_schema.description: Limit the number of Stream videos you want to get from the channel.

input_schema.name: Sort videos by
input_schema.description: Maps to the three sorting buttons on the top of the channel videos page. Currently only applies to the main tab: Videos. Note that the order is approximate, due to the asynchronous nature of the scraper, they might be a bit out of order

input_schema.name: Twitter URL you want to scrape
input_schema.description: This lets you tell the scraper where to start. You can enter Twitter URLs one by one. You can also link to or upload a text file with a list of URLs.

input_schema.name: Set the maximum number of tweets
input_schema.description: This value lets you set the maximum number of tweets to retrieve. Twitter has a default limit of around 800 tweets for profile URLs.

input_schema.name: Add user information
input_schema.description: Appends an object to each tweet containing the user information. You can decrease the size of your dataset by turning this off.

input_schema.name: Profile(s)
input_schema.description: Add the name of user you want to scrape.

input_schema.name: Max posts per profile (faster if 30 or lower)
input_schema.description: The number of posts that will be scraped from every profile. If set to 30 or lower, the scraper can utilize faster method of scraping that doesn't require scrolling.

input_schema.name: Posts newer than (e.g. 2023-06-15)
input_schema.description: Only posts uploaded after or on this date will be scraped.

input_schema.name: Posts from last (e.g. 2) days
input_schema.description: Specify how old scraped posts can be (in days). Putting 1 will get you only today's posts, 2 - tomorrow's and today's, and so on. If the Post newer than field was set, the most recent post will be chosen.

input_schema.name: Should download videos
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video files. Note that this will increase time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download video covers (thumbnails)
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video cover images (i.e. thumbnails). Note that this will increase time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download slideshow images
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok slideshow images. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Video Download Key-Value Store ID or Name
input_schema.description:
Name (or ID) of the Key Value Store where the videos and other media like thumbnails will be stored. Omit to store in the default one. Using this option will provide a named Key-Value store can help bypass data retention and store the content forever until the store is manually deleted.

The Key-Value store's name can consist of a versatile combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens, all without any spaces.

input_schema.name: Disable querying author stats if missing
input_schema.description: Sometimes Tiktok's API will not return author stats (their hearts, follower count etc) for profile/hashtag/sound pages, so an additional query will be needed. This will slow the scraper down

input_schema.name: Disable boosting with cheerio for small result count
input_schema.description: If the requested number of posts is small, the Cheerio crawler (much faster) will be used. If for some reason you need to disable this, turn on this option

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with

input_schema.name: Glob Patterns
input_schema.description: Glob patterns to match links in the page that you want to enqueue. Combine with Link selector to tell the scraper where to find links. Omitting the Glob patterns will cause the scraper to enqueue all links matched by the Link selector.

input_schema.name: Pseudo-URLs
input_schema.description: Pseudo-URLs to match links in the page that you want to enqueue. Combine with Link selector to tell the scraper where to find links. Omitting the Pseudo-URLs will cause the scraper to enqueue all links matched by the Link selector.

input_schema.name: Exclude Glob Patterns
input_schema.description: Glob patterns to match links in the page that you want to exclude from being enqueued.

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description: CSS selector matching elements with 'href' attributes that should be enqueued. To enqueue urls from

input_schema.name: Keep URL fragments
input_schema.description: URL fragments (the parts of URL after a #) are not considered when the scraper determines whether a URL has already been visited. This means that when adding URLs such as https://example.com/#foo and https://example.com/#bar, only the first will be visited. Turn this option on to tell the scraper to visit both.

input_schema.name: Page function
input_schema.description: Function executed for each request

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description:
Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

For details, see Proxy configuration in README.

input_schema.name: Proxy rotation
input_schema.description: This property indicates the strategy of proxy rotation and can only be used in conjunction with Apify Proxy. The recommended setting automatically picks the best proxies from your available pool and rotates them evenly, discarding proxies that become blocked or unresponsive. If this strategy does not work for you for any reason, you may configure the scraper to either use a new proxy for each request, or to use one proxy as long as possible, until the proxy fails. IMPORTANT: This setting will only use your available Apify Proxy pool, so if you don't have enough proxies for a given task, no rotation setting will produce satisfactory results.

input_schema.name: Session pool name
input_schema.description: Use only english alphanumeric characters dashes and underscores. A session is a representation of a user. It has it's own IP and cookies which are then used together to emulate a real user. Usage of the sessions is controlled by the Proxy rotation option. By providing a session pool name, you enable sharing of those sessions across multiple actor runs. This is very useful when you need specific cookies for accessing the websites or when a lot of your proxies are already blocked. Instead of trying randomly, a list of working sessions will be saved and a new actor run can reuse those sessions. Note that the IP lock on sessions expires after 24 hours, unless the session is used again in that window.

input_schema.name: Initial cookies
input_schema.description: The provided cookies will be pre-set to all pages the scraper opens.

input_schema.name: Browser Type
input_schema.description: Choose the browser to launch.

input_schema.name: Use Chrome (could only be used if Chromium Browser is selected)
input_schema.description: The scraper will use a real Chrome browser instead of a Chromium masking as Chrome. Using this option may help with bypassing certain anti-scraping protections, but risks that the scraper will be unstable or not work at all.

input_schema.name: Run browsers in headless mode
input_schema.description: By default, browsers run in headless mode. You can toggle this off to run them in headful mode, which can help with certain rare anti-scraping protections but is slower and more costly.

input_schema.name: Ignore SSL errors
input_schema.description: Scraper will ignore SSL certificate errors.

input_schema.name: Ignore CORS and CSP
input_schema.description: Scraper will ignore CSP (content security policy) and CORS (cross origin resource sharing) settings of visited pages and requested domains. This enables you to freely use XHR/Fetch to make HTTP requests from the scraper.

input_schema.name: Download media
input_schema.description: Scraper will download media such as images, fonts, videos and sounds. Disabling this may speed up the scrape, but certain websites could stop working correctly.

input_schema.name: Download CSS
input_schema.description: Scraper will download CSS stylesheets. Disabling this may speed up the scrape, but certain websites could stop working correctly.

input_schema.name: Max request retries
input_schema.description: Maximum number of times the request for the page will be retried in case of an error. Setting it to 0 means that the request will be attempted once and will not be retried if it fails.

input_schema.name: Max pages per run
input_schema.description: Maximum number of pages that the scraper will open. 0 means unlimited.

input_schema.name: Max result records
input_schema.description: Maximum number of results that will be saved to dataset. The scraper will terminate afterwards. 0 means unlimited.

input_schema.name: Max crawling depth
input_schema.description: Defines how many links away from the StartURLs will the scraper descend. 0 means unlimited.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Defines how many pages can be processed by the scraper in parallel. The scraper automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. Use this option to set a hard limit.

input_schema.name: Page load timeout
input_schema.description: Maximum time the scraper will allow a web page to load in seconds.

input_schema.name: Page function timeout
input_schema.description: Maximum time the scraper will wait for the page function to execute in seconds.

input_schema.name: Navigation wait until
input_schema.description: The scraper will wait until the selected events are triggered in the page before executing the page function. Available events are domcontentloaded, load and networkidle See Playwright docs.

input_schema.name: Pre-navigation hooks
input_schema.description: Async functions that are sequentially evaluated before the navigation. Good for setting additional cookies or browser properties before navigation. The function accepts two parameters, crawlingContext and gotoOptions, which are passed to the page.goto() function the crawler calls to navigate.

input_schema.name: Post-navigation hooks
input_schema.description: Async functions that are sequentially evaluated after the navigation. Good for checking if the navigation was successful. The function accepts crawlingContext as the only parameter.

input_schema.name: Dismiss cookie modals
input_schema.description: Using the I don't care about cookies browser extension. When on, the crawler will automatically try to dismiss cookie consent modals. This can be useful when crawling European websites that show cookie consent modals.

input_schema.name: Maximum scrolling distance in pixels
input_schema.description: The crawler will scroll down the page until all content is loaded or the maximum scrolling distance is reached. Setting this to 0 disables scrolling altogether.

input_schema.name: Debug log
input_schema.description: Debug messages will be included in the log. Use context.log.debug('message') to log your own debug messages.

input_schema.name: Browser log
input_schema.description: Console messages from the Browser will be included in the log. This may result in the log being flooded by error messages, warnings and other messages of little value, especially with high concurrency.

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: This object will be available on pageFunction's context as customData.

input_schema.name: Dataset name
input_schema.description: Name or ID of the dataset that will be used for storing results. If left empty, the default dataset of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Key-value store name
input_schema.description: Name or ID of the key-value store that will be used for storing records. If left empty, the default key-value store of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Request queue name
input_schema.description: Name of the request queue that will be used for storing requests. If left empty, the default request queue of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Hashtag(s) to scrape from TikTok
input_schema.description: Just add TikTok hashtags and the scraper will collect information about users, followers, likes, and more.

input_schema.name: Max posts per hashtag (faster if 15 or lower)
input_schema.description: Maximum number of posts that will be scraped from every hashtag. If set to 15 or lower, the scraper can utilize faster method of scraping that doesn't require scrolling.

input_schema.name: Should download videos
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video files. Note that this will increase time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download video covers (thumbnails)
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video cover images (i.e. thumbnails). Note that this will increase time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download slideshow images
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok slideshow images. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Video Download Key-Value Store ID or Name
input_schema.description:
Name (or ID) of the Key Value Store where the videos and other media like thumbnails will be stored. Omit to store in the default one. Using this option will provide a named Key-Value store can help bypass data retention and store the content forever until the store is manually deleted.

The Key-Value store's name can consist of a versatile combination of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, digits, or hyphens, all without any spaces.

input_schema.name: Disable querying author stats if missing
input_schema.description: Sometimes Tiktok's API will not return author stats (their hearts, follower count etc) for profile/hashtag/sound pages, so an additional query will be needed. This will slow the scraper down

input_schema.name: Disable boosting with cheerio for small result count
input_schema.description: If the requested number of posts is small, the Cheerio crawler (much faster) will be used. If for some reason you need to disable this, turn on this option

input_schema.name: Search
input_schema.description: Query to search on Zillow.com

input_schema.name: Type filter
input_schema.description: Property for sale/rent

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: Limit of home detail pages to be scraped

input_schema.name: Simple results
input_schema.description: Return only a subset of possible result attributes.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: List of URLs that will be crawled.

input_schema.name: Zillow home IDs
input_schema.description: List of ZPIDs that will be scraped.

input_schema.name: US Zipcodes
input_schema.description: List of zipcodes that will be scraped. Notice that this can take a lot of time to complete!

input_schema.name: Max zoom level
input_schema.description: Maximum map splitting level. The bigger number is set, the longer the scrape will take

input_schema.name: Minimum date
input_schema.description: Oldest date allowed in results. Can use literal dates, such as YYYY-MM-DD or relative ones, like 3 hours, 1 month, 2 days, today or yesterday

input_schema.name: Maximum date
input_schema.description: Newest date allowed in results. Can use literal dates, such as YYYY-MM-DD or relative ones, like 3 hours, 1 month, 2 days, today or yesterday

input_schema.name: Include more results
input_schema.description: Setting this option might give results close but outside to the original city / county / state.

input_schema.name: Max retries
input_schema.description: How many retries until the scraper should give up

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: How many requests can be running simultaneously

input_schema.name: Debug log
input_schema.description: Enable debug log

input_schema.name: Extend output function
input_schema.description: Extend the output item to contain more fields. The raw data is present in the 'data' variable.

input_schema.name: Extend Scraper Function
input_schema.description: Advanced function that allows you to extend the default scraper functionality, allowing you to manually perform actions on the page

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: Any data that you want to have available inside the Extend Output/Scraper Function

input_schema.name: Raw output
input_schema.description: Output the results without any filtering or formatting. It's recommended to leave this option unchecked.

input_schema.name: Direct URL(s) for scraping specific video(s)
input_schema.description: Add the URLs of posted videos you want to scrape. You can enter URLs one by one, or you can upload or link to a text file.

input_schema.name: Should download videos
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video files. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download video covers (thumbnails)
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok video cover images (i.e. thumbnails). Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Should download slideshow images
input_schema.description: Whether to download TikTok slideshow images. Note that this will increase costs and time required for the scrape

input_schema.name: Video Download Key-Value Store ID or Name
input_schema.description: Name (or ID) of the Key Value Store where the videos will be stored. Omit to store in the default one.

input_schema.name: Facebook URLs
input_schema.description: Valid facebook URL

input_schema.name: Results amount
input_schema.description: If this limit is not set only initial page of results returned

input_schema.name: Mode
input_schema.description: Select mode of the monitoring. Configuration run modes are Create, update and delete. Monitoring configuration will be created and all connected tools will be turned ON when 'Create configuration' is chosen. Choose 'Update configuration' mode when you already created the configuration and you just want to change some details of existing monitoring configuration. Option 'Delete configuration' turns the monitoring off and removes all the created tools and storages connected to the monitoring configuration.

input_schema.name: Monitoring suite name
input_schema.description: Name of your monitoring suite. It will be used in notifications and to identify related targets in the Apify dashboard.

input_schema.name: Type of target
input_schema.description: Only one type of target can be monitored by a single monitoring suite. If you want to watch more types, create more monitoring suites.

input_schema.name: Target name patterns
input_schema.description: Regular expressions that will be matched against selected actors / tasks or datasets under your Apify account. All matching targets will then be monitored by this monitoring suite. This is typically also the fastest way to select a single target. Just type its full name. Datasets are going to be automatically group by these patterns when dashboard statistics is counted for dataset target type, this can be overriden by setting the Group targets by name patterns option in the Statistics dashboard section.

input_schema.name: Target IDs
input_schema.description: If for whatever reason the Target name pattern option does not suit you, targets can also be specified by providing their IDs, as found in your Apify dashboard.

input_schema.name: Notify me whenever actor/task does not succeed
input_schema.description: It's the simplest checker we have. As the name suggests, it works only for actors and tasks and it will check for runs that either FAILED, TIMED-OUT or ABORTED, so you'll never miss a problem again.

input_schema.name: Group notifications
input_schema.description: It groups notifications to one notification report when more notifications should come within 5 minutes range instead of sending each of them separately. This can be useful when there are more actor/task runs that would finish all at once or close each other.

input_schema.name: Enable dashboard
input_schema.description: Collects statistics and produces a link to a dashboard with visualisations.

input_schema.name: Update frequency
input_schema.description: Choose how often should the dashboard statistics update. There are two basic options. Updating after each monitored run finishes or on a pre-set schedule. To update with every run, type: per run, each run or every run. To schedule updates, use plain English sentences such as every day at 13:30 or every Monday at noon or at 8pm every 1st day of the month. For more examples see: natural cron.

input_schema.name: Group targets by name patterns
input_schema.description: Regular expressions or name patterns that will be used to group your selected targets by it's name. Named datasets are by default grouped by targetPatternList, setting this option will override it. All matched targets will then be displayed as one data line in the dashboard charts. For example if you use the same group of scraping actors for different countries as actor-1-cz, actor-2-cz and actor-1-us, actor-2-us your patterns can be cz, us and all your your dashboard will display 2 data lines - one for each state.

input_schema.name: Notify me on dashboard updates
input_schema.description: You will be notified every time when the dashboard is updated with new data.

input_schema.name: Enable schema validation
input_schema.description: Datasets or default datasets will be validated using the provided validation options.

input_schema.name: Validation options
input_schema.description: The validation options specify your constraints. They are always an array of objects. This is to enable use of different schemas for different targets. See README for details.

input_schema.name: Validation frequency
input_schema.description: Choose how often will the schema checks run. There are two basic options. Updating after each monitored run finishes or on a pre-set schedule. To update with every run, type: per run, each run or every run. To schedule updates, use plain English sentences such as every day at 13:30 or every Monday at noon or at 8pm every 1st day of the month. For more examples see: natural cron.

input_schema.name: Send me report even if validation passes
input_schema.description: Validation checking report is going to be generated and sent via notification even if your data is correct.

input_schema.name: Enable duplicate items check
input_schema.description: Datasets or default datasets will be checked for duplicates using the provided unique key.

input_schema.name: Unique keys
input_schema.description: You can define a list of unique keys for the duplication checking. Each unique key represents the dataset field that will be compared for uniqueness. You should use something that's guaranteed to be unique among items in your dataset. Like email for people, SKU for e-shop items, GUIDs and so on.

input_schema.name: Number of allowed duplicates
input_schema.description: Represents acceptable number of duplicated items occurring in the dataset. The duplication check will pass and the notification won't be sent If the number of duplicated items is lower than the allowed number of duplicates.

input_schema.name: Check frequency
input_schema.description: Choose how often will the check for duplicates run. There are two basic options. Updating after each monitored run finishes or on a pre-set schedule. To update with every run, type: per run, each run or every run. To schedule updates, use plain English sentences such as every day at 13:30 or every Monday at noon or at 8pm every 1st day of the month. For more examples see: natural cron.

input_schema.name: Send me report even if check passes
input_schema.description: Duplicate checking report is going to be generated and sent via notification even if your data is correct.

input_schema.name: Disable email notifications
input_schema.description: If selected, email notification will not be sent.

input_schema.name: Custom address
input_schema.description: Email address to override your account email address.

input_schema.name: Custom subject
input_schema.description: Subject to override the generated subject of your notification email.

input_schema.name: Channel
input_schema.description: Insert Slack channel name, such as #notifications

input_schema.name: Token
input_schema.description: Insert application or user OAuth Access Token to the Slack API. Ask your workspace admin for help if needed.

input_schema.name: Instagram username
input_schema.description: Insert the username or URL of any profile you want to get posts from.

input_schema.name: Maximum posts per profile
input_schema.description: This is the maximum number of posts you want to scrape per profile. If you set it to 5, you'll get 5 posts for each profile you've included.

input_schema.name: Add Instagram Post URL(s)
input_schema.description: Add any number of Instagram post URLs to scrape comments from.

input_schema.name: Maximum comments (max 50 per post)
input_schema.description: This is the maximum number of comments you want to scrape from each post. If you set this to 5, you will get 5 comments for each URL provided (if you provide 2 URLs you will get 10 results altogether.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Choose to use no proxy, Apify Proxy, or provide custom proxy URLs.

input_schema.name: Page timeout
input_schema.description: Maximum time the scraper will spend processing one page.

input_schema.name: Maximum request retries
input_schema.description: How many retries before giving up.

input_schema.name: Use Chrome
input_schema.description: The scraper will use a real Chrome browser instead of a Chromium masking as Chrome. Using this option may help with bypassing certain anti-scraping protections, but risks that the scraper will be unstable or not work at all.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Use Apify Proxy or your own to run this actor.

input_schema.name: Maximum crawling depth
input_schema.description: How deep will the crawler follow links from the current page.

input_schema.name: Maximum pagination limit
input_schema.description: How far will the crawler follow pagination links.

input_schema.name: Destination
input_schema.description: Location name as you would search it on Airbnb.

input_schema.name: Number of results
input_schema.description: Limit the amount of results you want. Higher limits will take longer to scrape.

input_schema.name: Keep the dataset Excel friendly
input_schema.description: The scraper will get only core listing data from the Airbnb search result page.

input_schema.name: Link to an Airbnb Place
input_schema.description: Link to a room, house, flat, or apartment. When using this field, the scraper will ignore the Destination field and will get results only for specific listings.

input_schema.name: Include reviews
input_schema.description: Do you want to scrape reviews as well?

input_schema.name: Number of reviews
input_schema.description: Limit the number of reviews per listing. A higher number of reviews will take longer to scrape. If you leave this field undefined, all available reviews will be extracted. You can also use maxReviews: -1 to denote explicitly that you want to get all reviews.

input_schema.name: Availability for next months
input_schema.description: Scrape the host's calendar to monitor the listing's availability for future months. E.g. set 12 to get data for the whole year, set 0 to skip the calendar altogether.

input_schema.name: Include host info
input_schema.description: Scrape primary host info such as host URL and number of listings. This works in sync with the Keep the dataset Excel friendly toggle ↑

input_schema.name: Locale
input_schema.description: Localization that should be used for listing details and review comments. If unset, localization is inferred from each Airbnb start URL or is set to English if no start URLs are provided.

input_schema.name: Minimum price
input_schema.description: Filter listings based on a minimum price per night.

input_schema.name: Maximum price
input_schema.description: Filter listings based on a maximum price per night.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Use Apify Proxy or your custom Proxy.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Defines how many pages can be processed by the scraper in parallel. The scraper automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. Use this option to set a hard limit.

input_schema.name: Limit points
input_schema.description: Limits the number of geo points returned by the reverse API. The higher the number, the longer it takes. There's no upper limit.

input_schema.name: Timeout milliseconds
input_schema.description: Override the default 60s (60.000ms) timeout when not using Link to Airbnb Place.

input_schema.name: Debug Log
input_schema.description: Shows additional debugging information.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with.

input_schema.name: MODE
input_schema.description: Mode of the actor. Only pageviews and stress testing is enabled

input_schema.name: Enable Crawling
input_schema.description: Enables the crawling so that the actor can dive deeper on the target website.

input_schema.name: Youtube Pageview test (Experimental)
input_schema.description: Enables the video play for Youtube videos. To work, mode has to be set to PAGEVIEW. Please set Wait on Page attribute for the best experience.

input_schema.name: Wait on Page for N seconds
input_schema.description: If you want the actor to wait on the pages for a specific number of seconds, enable this option. Default is infinite.

input_schema.name: End after N seconds
input_schema.description: If you want to stop your actor after a while you can type the number of seconds. Default is infinite.

input_schema.name: Duplicate the actor
input_schema.description: If you want to run the actor in parallel then you can set the amount of actor duplications.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: List of web pages where the actor will start crawling.

input_schema.name: Maximum pages per start URL
input_schema.description: The maximum number of pages that will be enqueued from each start URL you provide.

input_schema.name: Maximum link depth
input_schema.description: The maximum number of links away from the Start URLs that the actor will crawl. If 0, the actor will not follow any links. If empty or null, the actor will follow links to arbitrary depth.

input_schema.name: Total maximum pages
input_schema.description: The maximum number of pages the crawler will load. It is always a good idea to limit the number of pages, otherwise the actor might run infinitely or consume too much resources.

input_schema.name: Stay within domain
input_schema.description: If set, the actor will only follow links within the same domain as the referring page.

input_schema.name: Pseudo urls
input_schema.description: regex for the url you want to enqueue. Put .* for crawling every url. Put https://www.google.com/search?q=ye.* for every google query that begins with 'ye'

input_schema.name: Probe frames
input_schema.description: If set, the actor will extract contact information also from IFRAMEs. Sometimes, you might not want that (e.g. this will include data from online ads).

input_schema.name: Proxy
input_schema.description: Proxy servers let you bypass website protections, avoid IP address blocking and view content for other countries. Try to use the proxy if you are experiencing timeout errors.

input_schema.name: Only emails
input_schema.description: If set, the actor will only extract contact emails (in case you don't need phone numbers, FB links...)

input_schema.name: Only one Email per website
input_schema.description: If set, the actor will stop crawling a website once he finds one email. Useful when you have a list of many websites, and want to find an email structure for instance

input_schema.name: Search
input_schema.description: Query to search on Yellow Pages

input_schema.name: Location
input_schema.description: Location to search entries in

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: List of URLs that will be crawled.

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: Maximum number of outputted results

input_schema.name: Extend output function
input_schema.description: A function which result will get merged with the default result

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: In this case the best option is usually no proxy. Otherwise US or UK proxies work best.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by the scraper.

input_schema.name: URL
input_schema.description: What URL you want to take screenshot of.

input_schema.name: Wait until
input_schema.description: Control's when will the browser take a screenshot

input_schema.name: Delay before screenshot
input_schema.description: Add's delay before a screenshot is taken. Mimimum is 0, maximum is 5 minutes (3600000ms)

input_schema.name: Width
input_schema.description: How wide should the website's viewport be

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Set the proxy configuration of the scraper

input_schema.name: Urls of Amazon categories
input_schema.description: Enter urls of Amazon categories. You can also use specific product URLs directly.

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: Enter maximum number of items that can be scraped. Remember this actor gets maximum 50 items per URL.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Use proxy to avoid blocking. You can set proxy groups from specific countries to get region-specific results.

input_schema.name: Detailed information
input_schema.description: Check if you want to get more information to the individual products.

input_schema.name: Debugging mode
input_schema.description: Check if you want to display debug logs.

input_schema.name: Search
input_schema.description: Google Search queries (e.g. food in NYC)

input_schema.name: Country
input_schema.description:
Country determines the IP address of the proxy used for the query and the Google Search domain (e.g. google.es for Spain). The values must be lower-cased ISO 3166 country codes supported by Google. By default, the actor uses United States (google.com).

This setting only applies to Search queries, but not to URLs.
