input_schema.name: Page scroll timeout (seconds)
input_schema.description: Set the timeout in seconds in which the page will stop scrolling down to load new items

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Either use Apify proxy, or provide your own proxy servers.

input_schema.name: Debug Mode
input_schema.description: Activate to see detailed logs

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: List of URLs that will be loaded by the crawler on start. For a POST request, append [POST] to the URL, e.g. http://www.example.com/[POST]

input_schema.name: Pseudo-URLs
input_schema.description: Specifies URLs of pages to crawl. Put regular expressions in [ ] brackets, e.g. http://www.example.com/[.*]

input_schema.name: Clickable elements
input_schema.description:
CSS selector used to find links to other web pages. Leave empty to ignore all links.

For example: a[href]

input_schema.name: Page function
input_schema.description: JavaScript function that is executed on every crawled page, use it to extract data. Note that only ES5.1 syntax is supported.

input_schema.name: Intercept request function
input_schema.description: JavaScript function called whenever the crawler finds a link or form leading to a new web page. Note that only ES5.1 syntax is supported

input_schema.name: URL #fragments identify unique pages
input_schema.description: Indicates that the URL fragment identifier (i.e. http://example.com/page#this-guy-here) should be considered when matching a URL against a Pseudo-URL or when checking whether a page has already been visited. Typically, URL fragments are used as internal page anchors and therefore they should be ignored because they don't represent separate pages. However, many AJAX-based website nowadays use URL fragment to represent page parameters; in such cases, this option should be enabled.

input_schema.name: Download HTML images
input_schema.description: Indicates whether the crawler should load HTML images, both those included using the tag as well as those included in CSS styles. Disable this feature after you have fine-tuned your crawler in order to increase crawling performance and reduce your bandwidth costs.

input_schema.name: Download CSS files
input_schema.description: Indicates whether the crawler should load CSS stylesheet files. Disable this feature after you have fine-tuned your crawler in order to increase crawling performance and reduce your bandwidth costs.

input_schema.name: Inject jQuery
input_schema.description: Indicates that the jQuery library should be injected into each page before Page function is invoked. Note that the jQuery object will not be registered into global namespace in order to avoid conflicts with libraries used by the web page. It can only be accessed through context.jQuery.

input_schema.name: Inject Underscore.js
input_schema.description: Indicates that the Underscore.js library should be injected into each page before Page function is invoked. Note that the Underscore object will not be registered into global namespace in order to avoid conflicts with libraries used by the web page. It can only be accessed through context.underscoreJs.

input_schema.name: Ignore robots exclusion standards
input_schema.description: Indicates that the crawler should ignore robots.txt, <meta name='robots'> tags and X-Robots-Tag HTTP headers. Use this feature at your own risk!

input_schema.name: Don't load frames and IFRAMEs
input_schema.description: Indicates that child frames included using FRAME or IFRAME tags will not be loaded by the crawler. This might improve crawling performance. As a side-effect, JavaScript redirects issued by the page before it was completely loaded will not be performed, which might be useful in certain situations.

input_schema.name: Verbose log
input_schema.description: If enabled, the log will also contain DEBUG messages. Note that this setting will dramatically slow down the crawler as well as your web browser and increase the log size.

input_schema.name: Disable web security
input_schema.description: If checked, the virtual browser will allow cross-domain XHRs and untrusted SSL certificates, so that your crawler can access content from any domain. Only activate this feature if you know what you're doing!

input_schema.name: Rotate User-Agent headers
input_schema.description: If checked, the crawler automatically rotates the User-Agent HTTP header for each new IP address, from a pre-defined list. This settings overwrites User-Agent set in Custom HTTP headers.

input_schema.name: Max pages per crawl
input_schema.description: Maximum number of pages that the crawler will open. The crawl will stop when this limit is reached. Always set this value in order to prevent infinite loops in misconfigured crawlers. Note that in cases of parallel crawling, the actual number of pages visited might be slightly higher than this value.

input_schema.name: Max result records
input_schema.description: Maximum number of pages the crawler can output to JSON. The crawl will stop when this limit is reached. This value is useful when you only need a limited number of results.

input_schema.name: Max crawling depth
input_schema.description: Defines how many links away from the start URLs the crawler will descend. This value is a safeguard against infinite crawling depths on misconfigured crawlers. Note that pages added using enqueuePage() in Page function are not subject to the maximum depth constraint.

input_schema.name: Execution timeout
input_schema.description: This field has been deprecated and its value is ignored. To set the execution timeout, use the actor run timeout option instead.

input_schema.name: Resource timeout
input_schema.description: Timeout for network resources loaded by the crawler, in milliseconds.

input_schema.name: Page load timeout
input_schema.description: Timeout for web page load, in milliseconds. If the web page does not load in this time frame, it is considered to have failed and will be retried, similarly as with other page load errors.

input_schema.name: Page function timeout
input_schema.description: Timeout for the asynchronous part of the Page function, in milliseconds. Note that this value is only applied if your page function runs code in the background, i.e. when it invokes context.willFinishLater(). The page function itself always runs to completion regardless of the timeout.

input_schema.name: Infinite scroll height
input_schema.description: Defines the maximum client height in pixels to which the browser window is scrolled in order to fetch dynamic AJAX-based content from the web server. By default, the crawler doesn't scroll and uses a fixed browser window size. Note that you might need to enable Download HTML images to make infinite scroll work, because otherwise the crawler wouldn't know that some resources are still being loaded and will stop infinite scrolling prematurely.

input_schema.name: Delay between requests
input_schema.description: This option forces the crawler to ensure a minimum time interval between opening two web pages, in order to prevent it from overloading the target server. The actual minimum time is a random value drawn from a Gaussian distribution with a mean specified by your setting (in milliseconds) and a standard deviation corresponding to 25% of the mean. The minimum value is 1000 milliseconds, the crawler never issues requests in shorter intervals than 1000 milliseconds.

input_schema.name: Max pages per IP address
input_schema.description: Maximum number of pages that a single crawling process will open before it is restarted with a new proxy server setting. This option can help avoid the blocking of the crawler by the target server and also ensures that the crawling processes don't grow too large, as they are killed periodically.

input_schema.name: Max parallel processes
input_schema.description: The maximum number of parallel processes that will perform the crawl. The actual number might be lower if the actor runs without enough memory. Note that each parallel process uses a different proxy (if enabled).

input_schema.name: Max page retries
input_schema.description: The maximum number of times the crawler will retry to open a web page on load error. Note that on page function errors, the pages are not retried.

input_schema.name: Custom HTTP headers
input_schema.description: Custom HTTP headers set by the crawler to all requests. It is an array of objects, where each object has the key and value properties.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Specifies the type of proxy servers that will be used by the crawler in order to hide its origin.

input_schema.name: Proxy type (legacy)
input_schema.description:
Specifies the type of proxy servers that will be used by the crawler.

This is a legacy option only kept for backwards compatibility, use proxyConfiguration instead!

input_schema.name: Proxy groups (legacy)
input_schema.description:
Specifies Apify Proxy groups to be used when proxyType is SELECTED_PROXY_GROUPS.

This is a legacy option only kept for backwards compatibility - use proxyConfiguration instead!

input_schema.name: Custom proxies (legacy)
input_schema.description:
Specifies Apify Proxy groups to be used when proxyType is CUSTOM. Each proxy should be specified in the scheme://user:password@host:port format, multiple proxies should be separated by a space or new line.

This is a legacy option only kept for backwards compatibility - use proxyConfiguration instead!

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: A custom JSON object that is passed to Page function and intercept request function as context.customData. This setting is mainly useful if you're invoking the crawler using the API, so that you can pass some arbitrary parameters to your code.

input_schema.name: Finish webhook URL
input_schema.description:
An HTTP endpoint that receives a POST request right after the run of this actor finishes. The POST payload is a JSON object with the following properties: actorId, runId, taskId, datasetId and data

For more information about finish webhooks, please see the actor README.

input_schema.name: Finish webhook data
input_schema.description:
Custom string that is sent in the POST payload to Finish webhook URL, as the data property.

For more information about finish webhooks, please see the actor README.

input_schema.name: Cookies persistence
input_schema.description:
Indicates how cookies collected by the crawler are persisted. This is useful if you need to maintain a login.

For more information about cookies, please see the actor README.

input_schema.name: Initial cookies
input_schema.description:
JSON array with cookies that the crawler starts with. This is useful for reusing a login from an external web browser. Note that if the Cookies persistence setting is Over all crawler runs, this field in the actor task configuration will be overwritten with new cookies from the crawler whenever it successfully finishes.

For more information about cookies, please see the actor README.

input_schema.name: URL
input_schema.description: URL to start with

input_schema.name: Query
input_schema.description: Job Title, Keywords, or Company

input_schema.name: Location
input_schema.description: City, country or zip code

input_schema.name: Location state
input_schema.description: Location state (abbreviation)

input_schema.name: Maximum results
input_schema.description: Limit number of results

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with

input_schema.name: Maximum number of items
input_schema.description: Maximum number of items that you want as output. Default is all

input_schema.name: Mode
input_schema.description: Select the mode that you want to initiate the actor

input_schema.name: Search
input_schema.description: The keyword that you want to search on. Eg: 'Medical'

input_schema.name: Extend output function
input_schema.description: A function which result will get merged with the default result

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Search Keywords
input_schema.description: Provide some keywords for Youtube channel search.

input_schema.name: Search Results Limit
input_schema.description: Search results limit for each search keyword.

input_schema.name: Max Requests Per Crawl
input_schema.description: Maximum number of pages that the crawler will open. The crawl will stop when this limit is reached.

input_schema.name: Direct URLs
input_schema.description: Provide some direct Youtube channel urls.

input_schema.name: Handle Page Timeout Secs
input_schema.description: Timeout in which the function passed as handlePageFunction needs to finish, in seconds.

input_schema.name: Max Request Retries
input_schema.description: Indicates how many times the request is retried if BasicCrawlerOptions.handleRequestFunction fails.

input_schema.name: Min Concurrency
input_schema.description: Sets the minimum concurrency (parallelism) for the crawl. Shortcut to the corresponding AutoscaledPool option.

input_schema.name: Max Concurrency
input_schema.description: Sets the maximum concurrency (parallelism) for the crawl. Shortcut to the corresponding AutoscaledPool option.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: The best option is usually Automatic proxy. But you can also use your own proxies or no proxy

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It should be list or detail URL

input_schema.name: Search Queries
input_schema.description: (Required if you don't use 'Input URL') Here you can provide a list of search queries as a Javascript array. This takes precedence over 'Input URL'.

input_schema.name: Include Comparison Prices
input_schema.description: (Optional) If you want to include the other shop prices, you can select this option as true. Please keep in mind that this option will slightly increase the total resource consumption.

input_schema.name: Country
input_schema.description:
Country determines the IP address of the proxy used for the query and the Google Shopping domain (e.g. google.es for Spain).

This setting only applies to Search queries, but not to URLs.

input_schema.description: First run the Google Maps Scraper. Then provide the ID of the Google Maps Scraper dataset that will be enhanced with contact details.

input_schema.name: Maximum pages per start URL
input_schema.description: The maximum number of pages that will be enqueued from each start URL you provide.

input_schema.name: Maximum link depth
input_schema.description: The maximum number of links away from the Start URLs that the actor will crawl. If 0, the scraper will not follow any links. If empty or null, the scraper will follow links to an arbitrary depth.

input_schema.name: Proxy
input_schema.description: Proxy servers let you bypass website protections, avoid IP address blocking, and view content for other countries. Try to use a proxy if you are experiencing timeout errors.

input_schema.name: Instagram username
input_schema.description: Just insert a username or URL of the profile you want to get the reels from.

input_schema.name: Maximum reels per profile
input_schema.description: Maximum number of reels you want to scrape per profile. If you set it to 5, you'll get 5 reels for each profile you've included.

input_schema.name: Company names
input_schema.description:
Search queries (e.g. Tesla)

Enter one item per line.

input_schema.name: Speed
input_schema.description: Adjust the speed of this Actor, by setting how many concurrent bot will be launched. The maximum number of search results pages the crawler will load in parallel. A higher number means you will get your results faster, but also it will burn through your available proxies quicker.

input_schema.name: Phone Number
input_schema.description: Provide a valid telegram phone number. This will be used to send the auth code to the Live View.

input_schema.name: Chat IDs
input_schema.description: Chat IDs to scrape. Use the Live View to see the chat IDs. Leave empty to restart the Live View.

input_schema.name: Max results
input_schema.description: The number of results that will be scraped from every chat id. If you have a lot of chats, you might want to limit the number of results per chat.

input_schema.name: Date filter
input_schema.description: Only load messages after this date - format: YYYY-MM-DD. Leave empty to load all messages.

input_schema.name: Filter
input_schema.description: Filter method to use. Leave empty to use no filter. 'Regex Search' will filter messages that match the regex.

input_schema.name: Filter value
input_schema.description: Filter value to apply to the messages. Leave empty to use no filter.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler. Leave empty to use no proxy.

input_schema.name: Search terms
input_schema.description: Terms for text search in Crunchbase

input_schema.name: Search modes
input_schema.description: Modes of actor while search keyword is presented.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of items on output
input_schema.description: Maximum number of items that you want as output.

input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It should be organization, person, event or hub detail URLs. Check README for more information.

input_schema.description: Function that takes each of the objects as argument and returns data that will be mapped by the function itself.

input_schema.description: Results details will show in this language.

input_schema.name: Location for search
input_schema.description: Any combination of city, zip code or locality for search

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: Limit of detail/product pages to be scraped

input_schema.name: Scrape company details
input_schema.description: If true, will also navigate to company page of each job posting, to scrape company info not available directly on job posting page

input_schema.name: Save Only Unique Items
input_schema.description: if true, only unique items will be scraped

input_schema.name: Follow redirects for apply link
input_schema.description: if true, will follow redirects of Indeed's externalApplyLink and output the final one

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Be nice to the website, don't go over 10

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: List of URLs that will be scraped or crawled. Can be main website URL, category/search URLs, company jobs URL (in the format of https://www.indeed.com/cmp/Google/jobs) or detail/product URLs. Using this disables search.

input_schema.name: Website(s)
input_schema.description: Similarweb websites to scrape. Enter domains or full Similarweb URLs.

input_schema.name: Max Request Retries
input_schema.description: Maximum number of retries for failed requests.

input_schema.name: Proxy Configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used.

input_schema.name: Page URLs
input_schema.description: URLs of the web pages to extract the metadata from. They must have either HTTP or HTTPS scheme.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Instagram username(s)
input_schema.description: Provide a profile URL of the account you want to scrape the posts from.

input_schema.name: Search queries (Add at least 50 for full speed scraping!)
input_schema.description: This lets you specify a list of search queries to use. The scraper will use these queries to search for tweets.

input_schema.name: (New) Replies depth (Read the description!) (Keep empty for old behavior!)
input_schema.description: How many levels of replies should be scraped. 0 means no replies, 1 means the tweet and its replies, 2 means the tweet, its replies and the replies of the replies, etc.

input_schema.name: (New) Include user id in every tweet result
input_schema.description: This will add the profile user id to every tweet result. This will be slower!

input_schema.name: (New) Include the profile user info in every tweet result
input_schema.description: This will add the profile user info to every tweet result. This is useful if you want to scrape tweets from multiple profiles and want to know which profile each tweet belongs to. This will be slower!

input_schema.name: Tweets newer than (since)
input_schema.description: This lets you specify the oldest date of tweets to extract, format YYYY-MM-DD. You can also use relative dates such as '1 month' or '2 days' instead of absolute dates such as '2020-02-29'.

input_schema.name: Tweets older than (until)
input_schema.description: This lets you specify the newest date of tweets to extract, format YYYY-MM-DD. You can also use relative dates such as '1 month' or '2 days' instead of absolute dates such as '2020-02-29'.

input_schema.name: Minimum number of replies
input_schema.description: Minimum number of replies a tweet must have to be scraped.

input_schema.name: Minimum number of retweets
input_schema.description: Minimum number of retweets a tweet must have to be scraped.

input_schema.name: Minimum number of likes
input_schema.description: Minimum number of likes a tweet must have to be scraped.

input_schema.name: From these accounts
input_schema.description: Scrape tweets from these accounts.

input_schema.name: To these accounts
input_schema.description: Scrape tweets to these accounts.

input_schema.name: Mentioning these accounts
input_schema.description: Scrape tweets mentioning these accounts.

input_schema.name: Include only native retweets
input_schema.description: This will include only native retweets in the results. Native retweets are tweets that have been retweeted without comment.

input_schema.name: Include only tweets with media
input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that contain media (images, videos, gifs, etc.)

input_schema.name: Include only tweets with images
input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that contain images

input_schema.name: Include only tweets with videos
input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that contain videos

input_schema.name: Include only tweets with news
input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that contain news

input_schema.description: This will include only tweets from verified users

input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that contain native video

input_schema.description: This will include only replies to tweets

input_schema.name: Include only tweets with links
input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that contain links

input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that have been marked as potentially sensitive

input_schema.name: Include only tweets that quote other tweets
input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that quote other tweets

input_schema.name: Include only tweets with pro video
input_schema.description: This will include only tweets that contain pro video

input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It should be list or detail URL

input_schema.description: The keyword that you can search on Dark Web site

input_schema.name: Maximum depth
input_schema.description: Maximum number of depth the crawler will dive into.

input_schema.description: Maximum number of pages that you want as output. Default is all.

input_schema.name: Extend output function

input_schema.name: Profile URL
input_schema.description: The URL of the profile you want to extract.

input_schema.name: Domains
input_schema.description: List of domains to crawl. The domains must be naked, i.e. specified without a protocol and sub-domains (e.g. example.com).

input_schema.name: Domains file URL
input_schema.description:
URL of a text file that contains the list of domains to crawl. The domains must be naked, i.e. specified without a protocol and sub-domains (e.g. example.com).

This field is useful if you have a large number of domains.

input_schema.name: Domains file offset
input_schema.description: Indicates how many domains from the file should be skipped in the beginning. This is useful if you only want to crawl a portion of the domains.

input_schema.name: Domains file count
input_schema.description: Indicates how many domains from the file should be crawled, starting from the offset. This is useful if you only want to crawl a portion of the domains. Leave empty to crawl all domains.

input_schema.name: Use Chrome
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor uses Chrome instead of Puppeteer's Chromium for the crawling. This might help to prevent blocking of some pages.

input_schema.name: Use Apify Proxy
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor uses Apify Proxy to access the target pages. This might help to prevent blocking of some pages.

input_schema.name: Max page retries
input_schema.description: Indicates how many times shall the crawler retry to load a page on error.

input_schema.name: Crawl domain links
input_schema.description: Indicates how many links from the main page going to the same domain shall also be crawled.

input_schema.name: Crawl HTTPS version
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor attempts to crawl HTTPs version of the website (e.g. https://example.com for domain example.com).

input_schema.name: Crawl www. sub-domain
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor attempts to crawl www. sub-domain of the website (e.g. http://www.example.com for domain example.com).

input_schema.name: Save screenshots
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor stores screenshots of all loaded pages into the key-value store.

input_schema.name: Save HTML content
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor stores HTML content of all loaded pages into the key-value store.

input_schema.name: Save text content
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor stores text content of all loaded pages into the dataset results.

input_schema.name: Consider child frames
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor searches for social handles even in the content of the first-level child frames. The 'page.text' also contains the combined text of the main frame and direct child frames.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It can be a any filtered leaderboard URL

input_schema.name: Type
input_schema.description: Select a type

input_schema.name: Time Interval
input_schema.description: Select time interval

input_schema.name: Sort by
input_schema.description: Select Sort by

input_schema.name: Maximum number of Items
input_schema.description: Maximum number of items that you want to scrape

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Dataset IDs
input_schema.description: Datasets that should be deduplicated and merged

input_schema.name: Fields for deduplication
input_schema.description: Fields whose combination should be unique for the item to be considered unique. If none are provided, the actor does not perform deduplication.

input_schema.name: What to output
input_schema.description: What will be pushed to the dataset from this actor

input_schema.name: Mode
input_schema.description: How the loading and deduplication process will work.

input_schema.name: Output dataset ID or name (optional)
input_schema.description: Optionally can push into dataset of your choice. If you provide a dataset name that doesn't exist, a new named dataset will be created.

input_schema.name: Limit fields to load
input_schema.description: You can choose which fields to load only. Useful to speed up the loading and reduce memory needs.

input_schema.name: Pre dedup transform function
input_schema.description: Function to transform items before deduplication is applied. For 'dedup-after-load' mode this is done for all items at once. For 'dedup-as-loading' this is applied to each batch separately.

input_schema.name: Post dedup transform function
input_schema.description: Function to transform items after deduplication is applied. For 'dedup-after-load' mode this is done for all items at once. For 'dedup-as-loading' this is applied to each batch separately.

input_schema.name: Where to output
input_schema.description: Either can output to a single dataset or to split data into KV records depending on upload batch size. KV is upload is much faster but data end up in many files.

input_schema.name: Parallel loads
input_schema.description: Datasets can be loaded in parallel batches to speed things up if needed.

input_schema.name: Parallel pushes
input_schema.description: Deduped data can be pushed in parallel batches to speed things up if needed. If you want the data to be in the exact same order, you need to set this to 1.

input_schema.name: Upload batch size
input_schema.description: How many items it should upload in one pushData call. Useful to not overload Apify API. Only important for dataset upload.

input_schema.name: Download batch size
input_schema.description: How many items it will load in a single batch.

input_schema.name: Offset (how many items to skip from start)
input_schema.description: By default we don't skip any items which is the same as setting offset to 0. For multiple datasets, it takes offset into the sum of their item counts but that is not very useful.

input_schema.name: Limit (how many items to load)
input_schema.description: By default we don't limit the number loaded items

input_schema.name: verbose log
input_schema.description: Good for smaller runs. Large runs might run out of log space.

input_schema.name: Dataset IDs for just deduping
input_schema.description: The items from these datasets will be just used as a dedup filter for the main datasets. These items are loaded first and then the main datasets are compared for uniqueness and pushed.

input_schema.name: Custom input data
input_schema.description: You can pass custom data as a JSON object to be accessible in the transform functions as part of the 2nd parameter object.

input_schema.name: Hashtags
input_schema.description: List of hashtags to extract profiles from.

input_schema.name: Number of Profiles to Collect per Tag
input_schema.description: Maximum number of profiles to collect per tag.

input_schema.name: Min. Followers
input_schema.description: Minimum number of follower

input_schema.name: Max. Followers
input_schema.description: Maximum number of follower

input_schema.name: Has Contact Email
input_schema.description: Only collect profile with contact email

input_schema.name: Instagram username
input_schema.description: Just insert a username or URL of the profile you want to get the user tagged user tagged posts from.

input_schema.name: Maximum user tagged user tagged posts per profile
input_schema.description: Maximum number of user tagged user tagged posts you want to scrape per profile. If you set it to 5, you'll get 5 user tagged posts for each profile you've included.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: Paste here a URL(s) of a specific place you want to get reviews from.

input_schema.name: Limit reviews for each place
input_schema.description: Use a large value (for example 1 million) to get all reviews from each place.

input_schema.name: Only reviews since date (YYYY-MM-DD)
input_schema.description: It is a date where the scraper stops loading older reviews

input_schema.name: Scrape reviewer info
input_schema.description: Scrape reviewer info (name, profile picture, location etc.). You should only extract reviewer's info if you have a legit reason to do so.

input_schema.name: Postal codes
input_schema.description: A whitespace-separated list of postal codes from which you need residential proxies. It cannot be used together with DMA codes.

input_schema.name: DMA codes
input_schema.description: A whitespace-separated list of Designated Market Area (DMA) codes as defined by Nielsen from which you need residential proxies. It cannot be used together with Postal codes.

input_schema.name: Min sessions per region
input_schema.description: Minimum number of residential proxy sessions to maintain and keep alive for a single postal code or DMA (whichever is specified). The higher the value, the more residential proxy traffic the actor will consume!

input_schema.name: Max sessions per region
input_schema.description: Maximum number of residential proxy sessions to maintain and keep alive for a single postal code or DMA (whichever is specified). The higher the value, the more residential proxy traffic the actor will consume!

input_schema.name: New sessions per heartbeat
input_schema.description: If there are not enough session per region to meet the minSessionsPerRegion criteria, we're adding new session in every heartbeat (i.e. every 20 seconds). The higher the value, the more residential proxy traffic the actor will consume, but the faster it will find enough matching sessions.

input_schema.name: Key-value store name
input_schema.description: Name of the Key-value store where to store the JSON file with the state. If empty, the actor stores data to the default key-value store associated with the actor run.

input_schema.name: Key-value record name
input_schema.description: The name of the record in the key-value store where the JSON file with the state is stored.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description:
A static list of URLs to scrape. To be able to add new URLs on the fly, enable the Use request queue option.

For details, see Start URLs in README.

input_schema.name: Use Browser
input_schema.description: If on, it will use regular borwser for scraping.

input_schema.name: Keywords
input_schema.description: List of keywords to search and count on every page

input_schema.name: Case sensitive
input_schema.description: If on, it will only match keywords with exact upper or lower case.

input_schema.name: Scan scripts
input_schema.description: If on, it will also count keywords appearing inside scripts.

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description:
A CSS selector saying which links on the page (<a> elements with href attribute) shall be followed and added to the request queue. This setting only applies if Use request queue is enabled. To filter the links added to the queue, use the Pseudo-URLs setting.

If Link selector is empty, the page links are ignored.

For details, see Link selector in README.

input_schema.name: Pseudo-URLs
input_schema.description:
Specifies what kind of URLs found by Link selector should be added to the request queue. A pseudo-URL is a URL with regular expressions enclosed in [] brackets, e.g. http://www.example.com/[.*]. This setting only applies if the Use request queue option is enabled.

If Pseudo-URLs are omitted, the actor enqueues all links matched by the Link selector.

For details, see Pseudo-URLs in README.

input_schema.name: Max depth
input_schema.description: How many links deep from the Start URLs do you want to crawl. Start URLs have depth 0.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description:
Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

For details, see Proxy configuration in README.

input_schema.name: Max pages per run
input_schema.description:
The maximum number of pages that the scraper will load. The scraper will stop when this limit is reached. It's always a good idea to set this limit in order to prevent excess platform usage for misconfigured scrapers. Note that the actual number of pages loaded might be slightly higher than this value.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Specified the maximum number of pages that can be processed by the scraper in parallel. The scraper automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. This option enables you to set an upper limit, for example to reduce the load on a target website.

input_schema.name: Retire Instance After Request Count
input_schema.description: How often will the browser itself rotate. Pick higher for smaller consumption, pick less to rotate (test) more proxies

input_schema.name: Use Chrome
input_schema.description: Only works for puppeteer type. Be careful that Chrome is not guaranteed to work with Puppeteer.

input_schema.name: Wait for
input_schema.description: Only works for puppeteer type. Will wait on each page. You can provide number in ms or a selector.

input_schema.name: Hashtags
input_schema.description: List of hashtags to extract profiles from.

input_schema.name: Number of Profiles to Collect per Tag
input_schema.description: Maximum number of profiles to collect per tag.

input_schema.name: Min. Followers
input_schema.description: Minimum number of follower

input_schema.name: Max. Followers
input_schema.description: Maximum number of follower

input_schema.name: Has Contact Email
input_schema.description: Only collect profile with contact email

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description:
A static list of URLs to scrape.

For details, see Start URLs in README.

input_schema.name: Glob patterns
input_schema.description: Glob patterns let you match links in the page that you want to enqueue. Combine them with the link selector to tell the scraper where to find links. Omitting the glob patterns will cause the scraper to enqueue all links matched by the link selector.

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description:
This is a CSS selector that says which links on the page (<a> elements with href attribute) should be followed and added to the request queue. To filter the links added to the queue, use the Pseudo-URLs setting.

If Link selector is empty, the page links are ignored.

For details, see Link selector in README.

input_schema.name: OpenAI API key
input_schema.description: The API key for accessing OpenAI. You can get it from OpenAI platform.

input_schema.name: Instructions for GPT
input_schema.description:
Instruct GPT how to generate text. For example: "Summarize this page in three sentences."

You can instruct OpenAI to answer with "skip this page", which will skip the page. For example: "Summarize this page in three sentences. If the page is about Apify Proxy, answer with 'skip this page'.".

input_schema.name: GPT model
input_schema.description: Select a GPT model. See models overview. Keep in mind that each model has different pricing and features.

input_schema.name: Content selector
input_schema.description: A CSS selector of the HTML element on the page that will be used in the instruction. Instead of a whole page, you can use only part of the page. For example: "div#content".

input_schema.name: Max crawling depth
input_schema.description:
This specifies how many links away from the Start URLs the scraper will descend. This value is a safeguard against infinite crawling depths for misconfigured scrapers.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

input_schema.name: Max pages per run
input_schema.description: Maximum number of pages that the scraper will open. 0 means unlimited.

input_schema.name: Use JSON schema to format answer
input_schema.description: If true, the answer will be transformed into a structured format based on the schema in the jsonAnswer attribute.

input_schema.name: Schema
input_schema.description: Defines how the output will be stored in structured format using the [JSON SchemaJSON Schema. Keep in mind that it uses function, so by setting the description of the fields and the correct title, you can get better results.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description:
This specifies the proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

For details, see Proxy configuration in README.

input_schema.name: Mode
input_schema.description: Basic mode scrapes only a list of the ranked universities with basic information. Detailed mode visits each university's detail page to collect detailed information. NOTE: It slows the running time dramatically

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: Limit of universities you want to get in final dataset. Max value is 100.

input_schema.name: Year
input_schema.description: A year of the QS rankings

input_schema.name: Max pages

input_schema.name: Notification emails

input_schema.name: Save only broken links
input_schema.description: If false, all checked links and all information about them will be saved (not CSV friendly).

input_schema.name: Crawl subdomains
input_schema.description: If true, actor will crawl all links recursively.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency

input_schema.name: CSV friendliness
input_schema.description: Remove results that are not CSV friendly.

input_schema.name: Set up your proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Automatic proxy and the country of your choice is usually the best option, but you can also select specific proxies, or use your own custom proxies.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: The maximum number of search results pages the crawler will load in parallel. A higher number means you will get your results faster, but also it will burn through your available proxies quicker.

input_schema.name: Page names
input_schema.description: Names of the public facebook pages to get posts from

input_schema.name: Max posts
input_schema.description: Limit the max number of posts to return

input_schema.name: Max post date in YYYY-MM-DD format
input_schema.description: Posts are retrieved from newest to oldest. Use this setting to limit how many posts in the past it should fetch.

input_schema.name: Min post date in YYYY-MM-DD format
input_schema.description: Set the minimum post date, remembering that posts start from newest to oldest, it will skip the newest posts up to the specified date

input_schema.name: Groups URLs by ID, if specified Pages and Search will be disabled
input_schema.description: URL by ID (NOT NAME!) i.e. https://www.facebook.com/groups/2246133101

input_schema.name: Amount of posts per group
input_schema.description: If this amount is not set no comments will be fetched

input_schema.name: Amount of comments per post from page or group
input_schema.description: If this amount is not random default comments will be fetched

input_schema.name: Mode: IMPORTANT! Facebook default might returns zero results
input_schema.description: Choose the way the comments are sorted

input_schema.name: Search posts by keywords
input_schema.description: Search posts and few additional top pages and profiles

input_schema.name: Search results amount
input_schema.description: If this limit is not set only initial page of results returned

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: A proxy server is required to run this actor! Either use an Apify residential proxy, or provide your own proxy servers. Datacenter proxies will not work.

input_schema.name: Max Retries
input_schema.description: maxConcurrency

input_schema.name: A list of Twitter search terms
input_schema.description: A list of Twitter search terms

input_schema.name: A list of Twitter URLs
input_schema.description: A list of Twitter URLs

input_schema.name: Maximum number of tweets to fecth for this run
input_schema.description: Maximum number of tweets to fecth for this run

input_schema.name: Select the Search mode. Default is 'Live' - it returns more tweet results
input_schema.description: Select the Search mode. Default is 'Live' - it returns more tweet results

input_schema.name: Max request retries
input_schema.description: Set the max request retries

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It should be listing or property detail URLs

input_schema.name: Include all images on detail
input_schema.description: This option enables all images from the detail pages. This option will increase the total requests and the total execution time slightly.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of properties
input_schema.description: Maximum number of properties that you want as output. Default is all

input_schema.name: Listing end page
input_schema.description: The page number that you want to end with. By default there is no end page.

input_schema.name: Search term
input_schema.description: Term for search on apartments.com

input_schema.description: Function that takes a JQuery handle ($) as argument and returns data that will be merged with the default output

input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Instagram PROFILES or POST URLs
input_schema.description: Only URLs to public profiles or posts expected to work, everything else will return error

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration

input_schema.description: Must be set to true if querying per URL ("https://linkedin.com/in/john-doe/") or false if querying per keyword or name (web developer)

input_schema.description: Filter by language eg da, es and so on. Can not be combined

input_schema.description: Filter by if review is verified. Type yes to filter by only verified reviews

input_schema.name: Page to start scraping from
input_schema.description: You can specify the page number (eg. 7) that the scraper should start from. If this is left blank it will scrape from page 1

input_schema.name: Page to scrape last
input_schema.description: You can specify the page number (eg. 9) that the scraper should scrape last. If this is left blank it will continue scraping to and including the last page

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It should be a list, category or product detail URLs

input_schema.description: Maximum number of items that you want to scrape

input_schema.description: The US postal code used to set the location.

input_schema.name: Include reviews
input_schema.description: Include reviews into each of the retrieved products

input_schema.name: Search job queries or URLs
input_schema.description:
Google Jobs Search queries (e.g. Teacher) and/or full URLs (e.g. https://www.google.com/search?q=teacher&ibp=htl;jobs).

Enter one item per line.

input_schema.name: Max pages per query
input_schema.description: The maximum number of search result pages for each search query.

input_schema.name: CSV friendly output (1 result on 1 row)
input_schema.description: If checked, the crawler will return results in a structure suitable for CSV format. Only 'googleJobs' results are included. CSV headers would be: title, companyName, location, description...

input_schema.name: Country
input_schema.description:
Notice: To get Google Jobs results from a location, please use UULE param(Setting country to 'es' will not return Google Jobs Results from Spain. To get Google Jobs Results from Spain, please use UULE param) .

This param is for the Google Search domain (e.g. google.es for Spain). The values must be lower-cased ISO 3166 country codes supported by Google. By default, the actor uses United States (google.com).

This setting only applies to Search queries, but not to URLs.

input_schema.name: UULE location code
input_schema.description:
The code for geolocation of search results. It's passed to Google Search as the uule URL query parameter. You can use the UULE code generator. Learn more about emulating local search.

This setting only applies to Search queries, but not to URLs.

input_schema.name: Jobs radius
input_schema.description: Allow you to search jobs within the radius - in kilometers.

input_schema.name: Filter Param
input_schema.description: Jobs results can be filtered by this filter param. The filter param can built from categories.param:categories.options.value. Eg: date_posted:today,employment_type:FULLTIME

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: The maximum number of search results pages the crawler will load in parallel. A higher number means you will get your results faster, but also it will burn through your available proxies quicker.

input_schema.name: Save HTML to dataset
input_schema.description: If checked, the HTML of Google Search results pages will be stored to the default dataset, under the html property. This is useful if you need to process the HTML, but it makes the dataset large and reduces performance.

input_schema.name: Save HTML to key-value store
input_schema.description: If checked, the HTML of the Google Search results pages will be stored to the default key-value store and links to the files stored to the dataset under the htmlSnapshotUrl property. This is useful for debugging, since you can easily view the the pages in browser, but use of this feature has some performance penalty.

input_schema.name: Include unfiltered results
input_schema.description: If checked, the lower quality results that Google normally filters out will be included. Usually it is few hundred extra results.

input_schema.description:
Acceptable Values:


location: Country, City, Continent
room IDs separated by spaces, commas or linebreaks
search URL: https://www.airbnb.com/s/Europe/homes?params=values

input_schema.description: If checked then simple HTTP request will be send instead of full Chrome browser.

input_schema.name: URL
input_schema.description: URL that links to a PDF file

input_schema.name: Where?
input_schema.description: Where you want to search? Be more specific if you seem to get the wrong location. You will only get the prices if you search within the USA (other countries are not supported with this feature on Google mapsa yet).

input_schema.name: How many places?
input_schema.description: The maximum number of places you want to find. The scrape is limited by what Google Maps shows, i.e. anything between 1 and 400 places.

input_schema.name: Post URLs

input_schema.name: Maximum request retries

input_schema.name: Page URLs
input_schema.description: List of URLs of web pages to take the screenshot of.

input_schema.name: Page load timeout
input_schema.description: Timeout for the web page load, in seconds. If the web page does not load in this time frame, it is considered to have failed and will be retried, similarly as with other page load errors.

input_schema.name: Page retry count
input_schema.description: How many times to retry to load the page on error or timeout.

input_schema.name: Wait until
input_schema.description: Indicates when to consider the navigation to the page as succeeded. For more details, see waitUntil parameter of Page.goto() function in Puppeteer documention.

input_schema.name: Viewport width
input_schema.description: Width of the browser window.

input_schema.name: Viewport height
input_schema.description: Height of the browser window.

input_schema.name: Delay before screenshot
input_schema.description: How long time to wait after loading the page before taking the screenshot.

input_schema.name: Image type
input_schema.description: Format of the image.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Specifies the type of proxy servers that will be used by the crawler in order to hide its origin.

input_schema.name: Search term
input_schema.description: Quora will search for questions using this strings.

input_schema.name: Language code
input_schema.description: Provide preferred site language. If used, it will query [langcode].quora.com instead of www.quora.com, e.g. es.quora.com for Spanish.

input_schema.name: Max answers per question
input_schema.description: Depending on popularity of your query you may encounter questions with many thousands of answers. Scraping these will require a ton of requests, especially if there are many such questions. Set to 0 to avoid scraping questions altogether and to -1 to disable this limit. Current approximate batch of answers per request is about 46-50, so if you set this limit to a lower value, you'd still get this much answers.

input_schema.name: Answers ranking
input_schema.description: Sort answers by selected parameter. On original Quora website you can also include related answers with this option, but currently this isn't supported.

input_schema.name: Use answer dataset
input_schema.description: Whether to store all answers in a separate dataset for easier extraction.

input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler. NOTE: residential proxies may not work with this scraper. Leave to none to use no proxy (very fitting if you run locally on your machine, will be much faster).

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: Set the maximum number of items you want to scrape. If you leave this field unset, the actor will extract all news since 2005-01-01. If you set this field to value less than or equal to 100, date filter won't be used. Otherwise, the scraper will search news per individual days.

input_schema.name: Extract images
input_schema.description: Check this option if you want to scrape preview images to the individual news. Note that these images need to be extracted separately from target URLs so it slows down actor's run significantly. Also note that the number of failed requests will increase as many different websites need to be crawled.

input_schema.description: Use either automatic Apify proxies or your own.

input_schema.description: Fetches only reviews and nothing else

input_schema.description: Maximum number of listing items that you want as output. Default is all

input_schema.description: The page number that you want to end with. By default there is no end page. This is applies to all search request and startUrls individually.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Requests
input_schema.description:
A static list of URLs to scrape.

For details, see the Start URLs section in the README.

input_schema.name: Pseudo-URLs
input_schema.description:
Specifies what kind of URLs found by the Link selector should be added to the request queue. A pseudo-URL is a URL with regular expressions enclosed in [] brackets, e.g. http://www.example.com/[.*].

If Pseudo-URLs are omitted, the actor enqueues all links matched by the Link selector.

For details, see Pseudo-URLs in README.

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description:
A CSS selector stating which links on the page (<a> elements with href attribute) shall be followed and added to the request queue. To filter the links added to the queue, use the Pseudo-URLs field.

If the Link selector is empty, the page links are ignored.

For details, see the Link selector in README.

input_schema.name: Page function
input_schema.description:
A JavaScript function that is executed for every page loaded server-side in Node.js 12. Use it to scrape data from the page, perform actions or add new URLs to the request queue.

For details, see Page function in README.

input_schema.name: Pre-navigation hooks
input_schema.description: Async functions that are sequentially evaluated before the navigation. Good for setting additional cookies or browser properties before navigation. The function accepts two parameters, crawlingContext and requestAsBrowserOptions, which are passed to the requestAsBrowser() function the crawler calls to navigate.

input_schema.name: Post-navigation hooks
input_schema.description: Async functions that are sequentially evaluated after the navigation. Good for checking if the navigation was successful. The function accepts crawlingContext as the only parameter.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description:
Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

For details, see Proxy configuration in README.

input_schema.name: Debug log
input_schema.description: Include debug messages in the log?

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Specifies the maximum number of pages that can be processed by the scraper in parallel. The scraper automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. This option enables you to set an upper limit, for example to reduce the load on a target web server.

input_schema.name: Max request retries
input_schema.description:
The maximum number of times the scraper will retry to load each web page on error, in case of a page load error or an exception thrown by the Page function.

If set to 0, the page will be considered failed right after the first error.

input_schema.name: Page load timeout
input_schema.description: The maximum amount of time the scraper will wait for a web page to load, in seconds. If the web page does not load in this timeframe, it is considered to have failed and will be retried (subject to Max page retries), similarly as with other page load errors.

input_schema.name: Page function timeout
input_schema.description: The maximum amount of time the scraper will wait for the Page function to execute, in seconds. It is always a good idea to set this limit, to ensure that unexpected behavior in page function will not get the scraper stuck.

input_schema.name: Ignore SSL errors
input_schema.description: If enabled, the scraper will ignore SSL/TLS certificate errors. Use at your own risk.

input_schema.name: Additional MIME types
input_schema.description: A JSON array specifying additional MIME content types of web pages to support. By default, Cheerio Scraper supports the text/html and application/xhtml+xml content types, and skips all other resources. For details, see Content types in README.

input_schema.name: Dataset name
input_schema.description: Name or ID of the dataset that will be used for storing results. If left empty, the default dataset of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Key-value store name
input_schema.description: Name or ID of the key-value store that will be used for storing records. If left empty, the default key-value store of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: A custom JSON object that is passed to the Page function as context.customData. This setting is useful when invoking the scraper via API, in order to pass some arbitrary parameters to your code.

input_schema.name: PDF URL
input_schema.description: The URL of PDF to be scraped.

input_schema.description: Keywords to search on Twitter. Supports hashtags.

input_schema.description: Maximum number of tweets that you want as output. Default is all

input_schema.name: Limit
input_schema.description: Max items to load from the dataset. Use with offset to paginate over the data (can reduce memory requirement of large loads).

input_schema.description: How many items to skip from the dataset. Use with limit to paginate over the data (can reduce memory requirement of large loads)

input_schema.description: Where to save the data from input after possibly transforming them during the download process.

input_schema.description: If you want to input the data from key-value store instead of dataset. Notation: storeId-recordKey, e.g. - kWdGzuXuKfYkrntWw-OUTPUT

input_schema.name: Upload to
input_schema.description: Where do you want to upload the image files

input_schema.name: Key-value store name
input_schema.description: Key-value store name where the images will be upload. Empty field means it will be uploaded to the default key-value store

input_schema.name: S3 Bucket
input_schema.description: Only relevant if you want to upload to S3! Name of the bucket where to upload.

input_schema.name: S3 Access key id
input_schema.description: Only relevant if you want to upload to S3! You can create these credentials for IAM user.

input_schema.name: S3 Secret access key
input_schema.description: Only relevant if you want to upload to S3! You can create these credentials for IAM user.

input_schema.name: Check if key is already on S3
input_schema.description: This option is useful if you don't want to rewrite the same image. GET requests are also cheaper than PUT requests

input_schema.name: Pre-download function
input_schema.description: Function that specifies how will be the data transformed before downloading the image. The input and output of the function is the whole data array. You can skip downloading images of any item if you add skipItem: true field to it.

input_schema.name: Post-download function
input_schema.description: Function that specifies how will be the data transformed before downloading the image. The input and output of the function is the whole data array. By default it adds either the file URL or errors array depending if the download was successfull.

input_schema.name: Max retries
input_schema.description: How many times should actor retry if the file it tries to download fails to pass the tests. Setting this too high can lead to unecessary loops.

input_schema.name: Image check type
input_schema.description: Type of the image check. If the image will not pass, the download will be retied with proxy and if that doesn't pass, the image is not uploaded.

input_schema.name: Min size in KB
input_schema.description: Minimum size of the image to pass the image check test

input_schema.name: Min width
input_schema.description: Minimim width of the image in pixels to pass the image check. Works only if the image check type is 'jimp'.

input_schema.name: Min height
input_schema.description: Minimim height of the image in pixels to pass the image check. Works only if the image check type is 'jimp'.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: You can specify how many maximum parallel downloading/uploading requests will be running. Keep in mind that the limit is here to not overload the host server.

input_schema.name: Download timeout in ms
input_schema.description: How long we will wait to download each image

input_schema.name: Batch Size
input_schema.description: Number of items loaded from dataset in one batch.

input_schema.name: Convert webp to png
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor will automatically convert all webp type images to standard png. This increases the size of the image.

input_schema.name: State fields
input_schema.description: You can specify fields that you want in your state to make it more readable and use less memory. By default it uses all.

input_schema.name: Run without download
input_schema.description: If checked, the actor will not download and upload the images. Usefull for checking duplicates or transformations.

input_schema.name: Language Detection
input_schema.description: Enables language detection for tweets. This option increases processing time but can be useful for data preprocessing. If a specific language is selected, this option is ignored.

input_schema.name: Collect Detailed User Information (3x slower)
input_schema.description: Collects detailed user information such as the total number of tweets, follower count, following count, and total likes. This option increases processing time (around 3x longer).

input_schema.name: Specific Twitter Profiles
input_schema.description: Provide a list of Twitter profiles to scrape. The profiles should be written as 'username' or '@username'

input_schema.name: Use Experimental Profile Scraper
input_schema.description: Activates an experimental profile scraper that uses the user timeline instead of search and should have a few months of history (can go back a few months rather than 10 days) but doesn't work with filtering, except tweet only will only return the user's tweets and replies.

input_schema.name: Specific Tweet URLs
input_schema.description: List the twitter search URLs you want to scape such as 'https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665' if your url contains more such as a cursor like 'https://twitter.com/elonmusk/status/1656898688739057665?s=20' only the tweets on the current screen will be loaded.

input_schema.name: Info to collect
input_schema.description: Options to either collect each tweet with all of its replies, only each tweet, or only the replies.
input_schema.value_options:
"user info and replying info": string
"only replying info": string
"only user info": string

input_schema.name: Twitter Search URLs
input_schema.description: List the full links to tweets you want to scape such as 'https://twitter.com/search?q=((MadMaxFuryRoad%20OR%20MadMax%20OR%20%22FuryRoad%22%20OR%20%22GeorgeMiller%22%20OR%20GeorgeMiller%20OR%20TomHardy%20OR%20%22CharlizeTheron%22%20OR%20CharlizeTheron)%20AND%20(Film%20OR%20Movie%20OR%20Review))&src=typed_query&f=top' if your url contains more such as a cursor only the tweets on the current screen will be loaded.

input_schema.name: Only tweets (no retweets, replies or quotes)
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets that are not retweets, replies, or quotes.

input_schema.name: Only verified users
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets from verified users

input_schema.name: Only verified users with Twitter Blue
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets from verified users with Twitter Blue

input_schema.name: Only retweets made using the retweet button
input_schema.description: Only retweets created using the retweet button. Works well combined with from: to show only retweets. Only works within the last 7-10 days or so.

input_schema.name: Only retweets or quoted tweets
input_schema.description: Old style retweets ('RT') + quoted tweets

input_schema.name: Only replies
input_schema.description: Returns tweets that are a reply to another Tweet

input_schema.name: Contain Quote Tweets
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return Quote Tweets

input_schema.name: Has some engagement
input_schema.description: Has some engagement (replies, favorites, retweets). Can be negated to find tweets with no engagement.

input_schema.name: All media types
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with any media type

input_schema.name: All images
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with any image

input_schema.name: All video types
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with any video type, including native Twitter video and external sources such as Youtube.

input_schema.name: Native Twitter images
input_schema.description: Filters content to only return tweets with native Twitter images (pic.twitter.com links)

input_schema.name: Only safe tweets
input_schema.description: Filters out unsafe tweets

input_schema.name: Author
input_schema.description: Written by a particular user. Useful if you want to use multiple custom queries for a single user.'

input_schema.name: In reply to
input_schema.description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

input_schema.name: Mentioning
input_schema.description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

input_schema.name: Geotagged near
input_schema.description: Geotagged in this place. Also supports Phrases, eg: near:'The Hague'

input_schema.name: Within Radius
input_schema.description: Within specific radius of the 'near' operator, to apply a limit. Can use km or mi. e.g. fire near:san-francisco within:10km

input_schema.name: Geocode
input_schema.description: To get tweets around a specific location, use geocode:lat,long,radius. E.g., to get tweets 10km around twitters hq, use geocode:37.7764685,-122.4172004,10km

input_schema.name: Place Object ID
input_schema.description: Search tweets by Place Object ID eg: USA Place ID is 96683cc9126741d1

input_schema.name: Minimum Retweets
input_schema.description: Specify minimum number of Retweets a tweet should have to be included.

input_schema.name: Minimum Favorites
input_schema.description: Specify minimum number of favorites a tweet should have to be included.

input_schema.name: Minimum Replies
input_schema.description: Specify minimum number of replies a tweet should have to be included.

input_schema.name: Start
input_schema.description: Specify the earliest date (inclusive) from which to start scraping tweets. The date should be in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

input_schema.name: End
input_schema.description: Specify the latest date (exclusive) until which to scrape tweets. The date should be in the 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

input_schema.name: Maximum Attempts
input_schema.description: Specify the maximum number of attempts to be made if a scrape operation fails. After reaching this limit, the failed operation will be skipped.

input_schema.name: Manually Set Number of Threads/Workers (if blank it will automatically optimize based on memory)
input_schema.description: Overrides the number of threads/workers automatically optimized for your memory amount. Could be useful for troubleshooting.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: Can be either category URL (https://www.amazon.com/s?k=something), product URL (https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09JQMJHXY) or seller URL (https://www.amazon.com/sp?&seller=A33VKVXKE1ZIAY)

input_schema.name: Max products
input_schema.description: Enter the maximum number of products you want to scrape.

input_schema.name: Save only seller
input_schema.description: Check this if you don't want to save any additional information about product and offers.

input_schema.name: Scrape all product offers
input_schema.description: Check this if you want to scrape sellers for all offers. Otherwise only the main seller will be scraped.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: You can set proxy groups from specific countries. Amazon shows you the products that can be shipped to your address based on the proxy you use. You don't need to worry about it if globally shipped products are enough for you.

input_schema.name: Snapchat Username
input_schema.description: Username

input_schema.name: Url to check
input_schema.description: Url to check

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Amazon category URLs
input_schema.description:
Pick one or a few Best Seller categories to scrape. If you enter a top-level category, all subcategories will be scraped (up to max depth).
Category URL has to contain Best-Sellers, best-sellers or bestsellers. To see examples of all accepted URLs, check out the readme.

input_schema.name: How many subcategories do you want to scrape?
input_schema.description:
Minimum value is 1, maximum is 4. Amazon Best Sellers covers 37 main categories. Each of those have at least one more subcategory level.
Setting this field to 2 will get you roughly 550 subcategories, each with 100 results.

input_schema.name: Detailed information
input_schema.description: Check this if you want to get the maximum amount of information about individual products. However, choosing this option means the scraper could take longer, since it is extracting more data.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: You can set proxy groups from specific countries. Amazon shows you the products that can be shipped to your address based on the proxy you use. You don't need to worry about it if globally shipped products are enough for you.

input_schema.name: Concerts Events
input_schema.description: Specifies whether concert events category should be scraped.

input_schema.name: Sports Events

input_schema.name: Input URLs
input_schema.description: The list of input URLs to be used. It can be URL for a specific team, player or league (e.g.https://www.flashscore.com/en/soccer/england/premier-league/#/nunhS7Vn/table/overall

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: The best option is usually Automatic proxy. But you can also use your own proxies or no proxy

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: List of URL entry points. Each entry is an object of type {'url': 'http://www.example.com'}

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description: CSS selector matching elements with 'href' attributes that should be enqueued. To enqueue urls from

input_schema.name: Max pages per run
input_schema.description:
The maximum number of pages that the scraper will load. The scraper will stop when this limit is reached. It's always a good idea to set this limit in order to prevent excess platform usage for misconfigured scrapers. Note that the actual number of pages loaded might be slightly higher than this value.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

input_schema.name: Max crawling depth
input_schema.description: Defines how many links away from the StartURLs will the scraper descend. 0 means unlimited.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Defines how many pages can be processed by the scraper in parallel. The scraper automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. Use this option to set a hard limit.

input_schema.name: Custom key value store
input_schema.description: Use custom named key value store for saving results. If the key value store with this name doesn't yet exist, it's created. The snapshots of the pages will be saved in the key value store.

input_schema.name: Custom dataset
input_schema.description: Use custom named dataset for saving metadata. If the dataset with this name doesn't yet exist, it's created. The metadata about the snapshots of the pages will be saves in the dataset.

input_schema.name: Timeout (in seconds) for backuping a single URL.
input_schema.description: Timeout in seconds for doing a backup of a single URL. Try to increase this timeout in case you see an error Error: handlePageFunction timed out after X seconds. .

input_schema.name: Timeout (in seconds) in which page navigation needs to finish
input_schema.description: Timeout in seconds in which the navigation needs to finish. Try to increase this if you see an error Navigation timeout of XXX ms exceeded

input_schema.name: URL search parameters to ignore
input_schema.description: Names of URL search parameters (such as 'source', 'sourceid', etc.) that should be ignored in the URLs when crawling.

input_schema.name: Only consider pages under the same domain as one of the provided URLs.
input_schema.description: Only backup URLs with the same origin as any of the start URL origins. E.g. when turned on for a single start URL https://blog.apify.com, only links with prefix https://blog.apify.com will be backed up recursively.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Choose to use no proxy, Apify Proxy, or provide custom proxy URLs.

input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It should be list or detail URL

input_schema.description: The page number that you want to end with. By default there is no end page.

input_schema.name: Clean Start
input_schema.description: By default, video links from queries, search or from channel links are scraped again, with the latest video data (views, subs, comments etc.). Set this to false if you don't want to gather the individual videos again. Default: true

input_schema.name: Number of Comments
input_schema.description: The maximum number of comments to be scraped per video. Default: 0.

input_schema.name: Get Related Videos
input_schema.description: Whether to get related videos. If given search keywords for queries gathers all related videos found in search results. Default: 0

input_schema.name: Twitter Search URLs
input_schema.description: List the full links to tweets you want to scape such as 'https://twitter.com/search?q=((MadMaxFuryRoad%20OR%20MadMax%20OR%20%22FuryRoad%22%20OR%20%22GeorgeMiller%22%20OR%20GeorgeMiller%20OR%20TomHardy%20OR%20%22CharlizeTheron%22%20OR%20CharlizeTheron)%20AND%20(Film%20OR%20Movie%20OR%20Review))&src=typed_query&f=top' if your url contains more such as a cursor only the tweets on the current screen will be loaded.
