input_schema.name: Max concerency
input_schema.description: Number of parallel threads crawling the products

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Run mode
input_schema.description:
This property indicates the scraper's mode of operation. In DEVELOPMENT mode, the scraper ignores page timeouts, doesn't use sessionPool, opens pages one by one and enables debugging via Chrome DevTools. Open the live view tab or the container URL to access the debugger. Further debugging options can be configured in the Advanced configuration section. PRODUCTION mode disables debugging and enables timeouts and concurrency.

For details, see Run mode in README.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description:
A static list of URLs to scrape.

For details, see Start URLs in README.

input_schema.name: URL #fragments identify unique pages
input_schema.description: Indicates that URL fragments (e.g. http://example.com#fragment) should be included when checking whether a URL has already been visited or not. Typically, URL fragments are used for page navigation only and therefore they should be ignored, as they don't identify separate pages. However, some single-page websites use URL fragments to display different pages; in such a case, this option should be enabled.

input_schema.name: Link selector
input_schema.description:
A CSS selector saying which links on the page (<a> elements with href attribute) shall be followed and added to the request queue. To filter the links added to the queue, use the Pseudo-URLs and/or Glob patterns setting.

If Link selector is empty, the page links are ignored.

For details, see Link selector in README.

input_schema.name: Glob Patterns
input_schema.description: Glob patterns to match links in the page that you want to enqueue. Combine with Link selector to tell the scraper where to find links. Omitting the Glob patterns will cause the scraper to enqueue all links matched by the Link selector.

input_schema.name: Pseudo-URLs
input_schema.description:
Specifies what kind of URLs found by Link selector should be added to the request queue. A pseudo-URL is a URL with regular expressions enclosed in [] brackets, e.g. http://www.example.com/[.*].

If Pseudo-URLs are omitted, the actor enqueues all links matched by the Link selector.

For details, see Pseudo-URLs in README.

input_schema.name: Page function
input_schema.description:
JavaScript (ES6) function that is executed in the context of every page loaded in the Chrome browser. Use it to scrape data from the page, perform actions or add new URLs to the request queue.

For details, see Page function in README.

input_schema.name: Inject jQuery
input_schema.description: If enabled, the scraper will inject the jQuery library into every web page loaded, before Page function is invoked. Note that the jQuery object ($) will not be registered into global namespace in order to avoid conflicts with libraries used by the web page. It can only be accessed through context.jQuery in Page function.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description:
Specifies proxy servers that will be used by the scraper in order to hide its origin.

For details, see Proxy configuration in README.

input_schema.name: Proxy rotation
input_schema.description: This property indicates the strategy of proxy rotation and can only be used in conjunction with Apify Proxy. The recommended setting automatically picks the best proxies from your available pool and rotates them evenly, discarding proxies that become blocked or unresponsive. If this strategy does not work for you for any reason, you may configure the scraper to either use a new proxy for each request, or to use one proxy as long as possible, until the proxy fails. IMPORTANT: This setting will only use your available Apify Proxy pool, so if you don't have enough proxies for a given task, no rotation setting will produce satisfactory results.

input_schema.name: Session pool name
input_schema.description: Use only english alphanumeric characters dashes and underscores. A session is a representation of a user. It has it's own IP and cookies which are then used together to emulate a real user. Usage of the sessions is controlled by the Proxy rotation option. By providing a session pool name, you enable sharing of those sessions across multiple actor runs. This is very useful when you need specific cookies for accessing the websites or when a lot of your proxies are already blocked. Instead of trying randomly, a list of working sessions will be saved and a new actor run can reuse those sessions. Note that the IP lock on sessions expires after 24 hours, unless the session is used again in that window.

input_schema.name: Initial cookies
input_schema.description: A JSON array with cookies that will be set to every Chrome browser tab opened before loading the page, in the format accepted by Puppeteer's Page.setCookie() function. This option is useful for transferring a logged-in session from an external web browser. For details how to do this, read this help article.

input_schema.name: Use Chrome
input_schema.description: If enabled, the scraper will use a real Chrome browser instead of Chromium bundled with Puppeteer. This option may help bypass certain anti-scraping protections, but might make the scraper unstable. Use at your own risk 🙂

input_schema.name: Ignore SSL errors
input_schema.description: If enabled, the scraper will ignore SSL/TLS certificate errors. Use at your own risk.

input_schema.name: Ignore CORS and CSP
input_schema.description: If enabled, the scraper will ignore Content Security Policy (CSP) and Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) settings of visited pages and requested domains. This enables you to freely use XHR/Fetch to make HTTP requests from Page function.

input_schema.name: Download media files
input_schema.description: If enabled, the scraper will download media such as images, fonts, videos and sound files, as usual. Disabling this option might speed up the scrape, but certain websites could stop working correctly.

input_schema.name: Download CSS files
input_schema.description: If enabled, the scraper will download CSS files with stylesheets, as usual. Disabling this option may speed up the scrape, but certain websites could stop working correctly, and the live view will not look as cool.

input_schema.name: Max page retries
input_schema.description:
The maximum number of times the scraper will retry to load each web page on error, in case of a page load error or an exception thrown by Page function.

If set to 0, the page will be considered failed right after the first error.

input_schema.name: Max pages per run
input_schema.description:
The maximum number of pages that the scraper will load. The scraper will stop when this limit is reached. It's always a good idea to set this limit in order to prevent excess platform usage for misconfigured scrapers. Note that the actual number of pages loaded might be slightly higher than this value.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

input_schema.name: Max result records
input_schema.description:
The maximum number of records that will be saved to the resulting dataset. The scraper will stop when this limit is reached.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

input_schema.name: Max crawling depth
input_schema.description:
Specifies how many links away from Start URLs the scraper will descend. This value is a safeguard against infinite crawling depths for misconfigured scrapers. Note that pages added using context.enqueuePage() in Page function are not subject to the maximum depth constraint.

If set to 0, there is no limit.

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Specified the maximum number of pages that can be processed by the scraper in parallel. The scraper automatically increases and decreases concurrency based on available system resources. This option enables you to set an upper limit, for example to reduce the load on a target web server.

input_schema.name: Page load timeout
input_schema.description: The maximum amount of time the scraper will wait for a web page to load, in seconds. If the web page does not load in this timeframe, it is considered to have failed and will be retried (subject to Max page retries), similarly as with other page load errors.

input_schema.name: Page function timeout
input_schema.description: The maximum amount of time the scraper will wait for Page function to execute, in seconds. It's a good idea to set this limit, to ensure that unexpected behavior in page function will not get the scraper stuck.

input_schema.name: Navigation waits until
input_schema.description:
Contains a JSON array with names of page events to wait, before considering a web page fully loaded. The scraper will wait until all of the events are triggered in the web page before executing Page function. Available events are domcontentloaded, load, networkidle2 and networkidle0.

For details, see waitUntil option in Puppeteer's Page.goto() function documentation.

input_schema.name: Pre-navigation hooks
input_schema.description: Async functions that are sequentially evaluated before the navigation. Good for setting additional cookies or browser properties before navigation. The function accepts two parameters, crawlingContext and gotoOptions, which are passed to the page.goto() function the crawler calls to navigate.

input_schema.name: Post-navigation hooks
input_schema.description: Async functions that are sequentially evaluated after the navigation. Good for checking if the navigation was successful. The function accepts crawlingContext as the only parameter.

input_schema.name: Insert breakpoint
input_schema.description:
This property has no effect if Run mode is set to PRODUCTION. When set to DEVELOPMENT it inserts a breakpoint at the selected location in every page the scraper visits. Execution of code stops at the breakpoint until manually resumed in the DevTools window accessible via Live View tab or Container URL. Additional breakpoints can be added by adding debugger; statements within your Page function.

See Run mode in README for details.

input_schema.name: Debug log
input_schema.description: If enabled, the actor log will include debug messages. Beware that this can be quite verbose. Use context.log.debug('message') to log your own debug messages from Page function.

input_schema.name: Browser log
input_schema.description: If enabled, the actor log will include console messages produced by JavaScript executed by the web pages (e.g. using console.log()). Beware that this may result in the log being flooded by error messages, warnings and other messages of little value, especially with high concurrency.

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: A custom JSON object that is passed to Page function as context.customData. This setting is useful when invoking the scraper via API, in order to pass some arbitrary parameters to your code.

input_schema.name: Dataset name
input_schema.description: Name or ID of the dataset that will be used for storing results. If left empty, the default dataset of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Key-value store name
input_schema.description: Name or ID of the key-value store that will be used for storing records. If left empty, the default key-value store of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Request queue name
input_schema.description: Name of the request queue that will be used for storing requests. If left empty, the default request queue of the run will be used.

input_schema.name: Start page
input_schema.description: Page number to start scraping

input_schema.description: Leave this field empty if you want to scrape all items.

input_schema.description: You can use proxy from your account's country if needed for extra safety.

input_schema.name: Location UULE
input_schema.description: The code for the exact location for the Google search. It's passed to Google Search as the uule URL query parameter. You can use the UULE code generator https://padavvan.github.io/

input_schema.name: Maximum number of items
input_schema.description: Maximum number of items that you want as output. Default is all

input_schema.name: Results per page
input_schema.description: Number of search results for each Google result page. By default, Google Search returns 10 results per page. The allowed values are 10, 20, 30, 40, 50 and 100.
input_schema.value_options:
"10": string
"20": string
"30": string
"40": string
"50": string
"100": string

input_schema.name: Include unfiltered results
input_schema.description: If checked, the lower-quality results that Google normally filters out will be included. This usually consists of a few hundred extra results.

input_schema.name: List end page
input_schema.description: The page number that you want to end with. By default there is no end page. This is applies to all search request and startUrls individually.

input_schema.name: Extend output function
input_schema.description: Function that takes a JQuery handle ($) as argument and returns data that will be merged with the default output

input_schema.name: Custom map function
input_schema.description: Function that takes each of the objects as argument and returns data that will be mapped by the function itself.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Rud IDs (or text file ULRs)
input_schema.description: List of runs to check. Also can be URLs to any text files.

input_schema.name: Matching regexes
input_schema.description: List of regexes to match on each line of the text. Can be in plain string format (Error) or in regex format that allows regex flags (/error/i)

input_schema.name: Actor or task ID
input_schema.description: Actor or task ID

input_schema.name: Date from
input_schema.description: Optional date to limit from which date the run will be scanned. The date should be in ISO standard (e.g. 2020-10-01)

input_schema.name: Date to
input_schema.description: Optional date to limit to which date the run will be scanned. The date should be in ISO standard (e.g. 2020-10-15)

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with.

input_schema.name: Results limit
input_schema.description: Maximum number of results

input_schema.name: Include Extended Information
input_schema.description: Including extended information. This will increase the resource consumption proportional to number of products.

input_schema.name: Include Reviews (20)
input_schema.description: Including reviews. It requires extended info data. This will increase the resource consumption proportional to number of products.

input_schema.name: Include Questions & Answers (20)
input_schema.description: Including Questions & Answers. It requires extended info data. This will increase the resource consumption proportional to number of products.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: How many items to extract from polyandbark.com

input_schema.name: Extend Output Function
input_schema.description: Add or remove properties on the output object or omit the output returning null

input_schema.name: Extend Scraper Function
input_schema.description: Advanced function that allows you to extend the default scraper functionality, allowing you to manually perform actions on the page

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: Any data that you want to have available inside the Extend Output/Scraper Function

input_schema.name: Fetch HTML
input_schema.description: If you decide to fetch the HTML of the pages, it will take twice as long. Make sure to only enable this if needed

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Max concurrency to use

input_schema.name: Max request retries
input_schema.description: Set the max request retries

input_schema.name: Debug Log
input_schema.description: Enable a more verbose logging to be able to understand what's happening during the scraping

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: Can be main page URL or any category URLs. Article pages are found and enqueued from these.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of articles
input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Date from
input_schema.description: Only articles from this day to present will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or Number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

input_schema.name: Only new articles
input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.name: 🔨 Action
input_schema.description: Select an action to perform
input_schema.value_options:
"getApps": string
"getAppDetails": string
"getSimilarApps": string
"searchApps": string
"getDevelopperApps": string
"getAppReviews": string
"getPrivacy": string
"getRatings": string

input_schema.name: 🔢 Number max of rows
input_schema.description: Number of rows to get

input_schema.name: 🔗 App id or url
input_schema.description: Provide app id or url here => 'com.google.android.apps.translate' or 'https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.google.android.apps.translate'

input_schema.name: 🔗 Developer id or url
input_schema.description: Provide developer id or url here => '5700313618786177705' or 'https://play.google.com/store/apps/dev?id=5700313618786177705'

input_schema.name: Split sentences
input_schema.description:
Sets whether the translation engine should first split the input into sentences. This is enabled by default.
For applications that send one sentence per text parameter, it is advisable to set split_sentences=0, in order to prevent the engine from splitting the sentence unintentionally.

input_schema.name: Preserve formatting
input_schema.description:
Sets whether the translation engine should respect the original formatting, even if it would usually correct some aspects.
The formatting aspects affected by this setting include:
-Punctuation at the beginning and end of the sentence
-Upper/lower case at the beginning of the sentence

input_schema.name: Formality
input_schema.description: Sets whether the translated text should lean towards formal or informal language. This feature currently only works for target languages 'DE' (German), 'FR' (French), 'IT' (Italian), 'ES' (Spanish), 'NL' (Dutch), 'PL' (Polish), 'PT-PT', 'PT-BR' (Portuguese) and 'RU' (Russian).

input_schema.name: Glossary ID
input_schema.description: Specify the glossary to use for the translation. Important: This requires the source_lang parameter to be set and the language pair of the glossary has to match the language pair of the request.

input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.name: Search Query
input_schema.description: You can search for ads containing words in a specific order or ads containing words in any order. For example, “red shoe sale” will bring up search results for all ads that contain “red shoe sale.” Don't use quotation marks if you're searching for ads containing multiple words in any order.

input_schema.name: Limit search terms per run

input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Storage type
input_schema.description: Type of the storages you want to delete.

input_schema.name: Matching expression
input_schema.description: A regular expression in a string format used to match the names of storages to be deleted. It will be used to create an instance of RegExp using new RegExp(expression) All storages matching the pattern will be deleted unless other filters are provided.

input_schema.name: Storage creation date
input_schema.description: Use YYYY-MM-DD format. The option limits the deleted storages to the ones created on the provided date. If you want to delete all storages from a given date, use '.*' as your Matching expression.

input_schema.name: Max deleted storages
input_schema.description: Limit the number of deleted storages to the given amount.

input_schema.name: Newest first
input_schema.description: Sort storages from newest to oldest. In combination with the Max storages to delete option, this enables to "delete 5 newest storages" and similar commands.

input_schema.name: Force delete
input_schema.description: If you are REALLY AND ABSOLUTELY sure that your filters will delete exactly the storages you need then you can use this flag to delete them immediately without the need for confirmation by a second run of the actor. Tread carefully!

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: Can be main page URL or any category URLs. Article pages are found and enqueued from these.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of articles
input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Date from
input_schema.description: Only articles from this day to present will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or Number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

input_schema.name: Only new articles
input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.name: Actor Id
input_schema.description: Id of the actor whose datasets the validity checker is supposed to process.

input_schema.name: Task Id
input_schema.description: Id of the task whose datasets the validity checker is supposed to process. Supersedes the actId.

input_schema.name: User Token
input_schema.description: Token of the user owning the examined actor/task. If not filled, token of the user starting the Dataset Validity Checker is used.

input_schema.name: Warning Email
input_schema.description: An email, where warnings about invalid datasets should be sent.

input_schema.name: Clear History
input_schema.description: Set to true if you want the validity checker to discard all previously gathered information about datasets and start anew. You should use this option if you change the actor in a way that significantly changes its results, or if the website changes significantly in a way, that doesn't actually break your actor (e.g. the amount of different items available for purchase at an e-shop changes drastically).

input_schema.name: Previous Datasets Considered
input_schema.description: A number of previous datasets that will be considered when determining whether the dataset is valid. If not filled, the value will be 100.

input_schema.name: Minimal Datasets
input_schema.description: Minimal number of datasets processed needed to validate further datasets. Needs to be at most the same value as 'Previous Datasets Considered Count'. If not filled, the value will be 10.

input_schema.name: Number Handling Policy
input_schema.description: Governs what attributes the Dataset Validity Checker considers to be numbers. If it is 'Strict', only values saved as number type will be considered as such. If 'Loose', strings that are numbers in a non-scientific notation are also handled like numbers. 'Strict' policy is generally better, but if you don't convert numbers to the proper type, using 'Loose' should give you better results.

input_schema.name: Starting At
input_schema.description: Allows you to control, what will be the earliest run whose dataset will be processed by this run of Dataset Validity Checker. Will be superseded, if runs from later time have already been processed. Has to be ISO 8601 compliant date/time in UTC.

input_schema.name: Until
input_schema.description: Allows you to control, what will be the latest run whose dataset will be processed by this run of Dataset Validity Checker. Has to be ISO 8601 compliant date/time in UTC.

input_schema.name: Average Multiplying Coefficient
input_schema.description: Controls how different the dataset can be compared to the previously seen datasets to still be considered valid in terms of multiples of average difference. Default value is 5.

input_schema.name: Maximal Multiplying Coefficient
input_schema.description: Controls how different the dataset can be compared to the previously seen datasets to still be considered valid in terms of multiples of maximal difference. Default value is 2.

input_schema.name: Leniency Coefficient
input_schema.description: Allows you to control both 'Maximal Multiplying Coefficient' and 'Average Multiplying Coefficient' at the same time. Is multiplicative, so a value of 2 increases both of them by a factor of 2. Default value is 1.

input_schema.name: HTTP Endpoints
input_schema.description: HTTP(s) endpoints that will receive the run information through a JSON POST. Configure your data below on "Transform endpoint data" field

input_schema.name: Emails
input_schema.description: Optional emails that should receive the digests. You need to specify this or the HTTP Endpoints parameter

input_schema.name: Task IDs
input_schema.description: Existing task IDs that will be modified to receive the webhook configuration.

input_schema.name: Actor IDs

input_schema.name: Location
input_schema.description: Where you want to look for the real estates, e.g. Madrid. For further filtering you can use the URL below.

input_schema.name: Country
input_schema.description: Select your country

input_schema.name: Limit the number of items
input_schema.description: How many real estates do you want to get. If you don't want to get all items, because you maybe only want to test the solution, or want to know what are the new real estates on the market.

input_schema.name: URL you want to scrape
input_schema.description: URL(s) of places or pages what will be scraped. For example https://www.idealista.com/venta-viviendas/madrid/centro/con-de-tres-dormitorios,de-cuatro-cinco-habitaciones-o-mas,tres-banos-o-mas/

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: Can be main page URL or any category URLs. Article pages are found and enqueued from these.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of articles
input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Date from
input_schema.description: Only articles from this day to present will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or Number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

input_schema.name: Only new articles
input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: URLs to start with. It should be topic, category, author, search or article detail URL

input_schema.name: Search keyword
input_schema.description: The keyword that you can search articles on Newsweek

input_schema.name: Maximum number of listing items
input_schema.description: Maximum number of listing items that you want as output. Default is all

input_schema.name: List end page
input_schema.description: The page number that you want to end with. By default there is no end page. This is applies to all search request and startUrls individually.

input_schema.name: Extend output function
input_schema.description: Function that takes a JQuery handle ($) as argument and returns data that will be merged with the default output

input_schema.name: Custom map function
input_schema.description: Function that takes each of the objects as argument and returns data that will be mapped by the function itself.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Regular Expression
input_schema.description: Regular expression to match the name of the actors you want to rebuild. It's a string that will be used to construct a RegExp instance, so make sure to use proper escaping!

input_schema.name: Version
input_schema.description: Other versions than 0.0 of the actors can be rebuilt if a different version is specified. Unfortunately, using tags is not supported by Apify at the moment.

input_schema.name: Build tag
input_schema.description: Tag to use for all the builds.

input_schema.name: Wait for finish
input_schema.description: Check this to tell the actor to wait for completion of all builds. This is useful when tied with a webhook that would then notify you of errors.

input_schema.name: Fetch HTML
input_schema.description: If you decide to fetch the HTML of the pages, it will take twice as long. Make sure to only enable this if needed

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Max concurrency to use

input_schema.name: Max request retries
input_schema.description: Set the max request retries

input_schema.name: Debug Log
input_schema.description: Enable a more verbose logging to be able to understand what's happening during the scraping

input_schema.name: Search Titles
input_schema.description: Specify the titles you wish to search for within the myAnimeList database.

input_schema.name: Search URLs
input_schema.description: Provide the specific URLs of anime or manga you want to search for on myAnimeList.

input_schema.name: Number of Pages of Episodes
input_schema.description: Enter the number of pages of episodes required. Each page contains 100 episodes.

input_schema.name: Number of Pages of Reviews
input_schema.description: Enter the number of pages of reviews required. Each page contains 20 reviews.

input_schema.name: Test
input_schema.description: There is testing input field description.

input_schema.name: Username
input_schema.description: FTP username

input_schema.name: Password
input_schema.description: FTP password

input_schema.name: Host
input_schema.description: FTP host

input_schema.name: Port
input_schema.description: FTP port

input_schema.name: FTP folder
input_schema.description: FTP folder

input_schema.name: File URLs
input_schema.description: File URLs

input_schema.name: Target Actor ID
input_schema.description: Actor ID which mapped input will run.

input_schema.name: Target Task ID
input_schema.description: Task ID which mapped input will run.

input_schema.name: Input mapping function
input_schema.description: Function that will create input for target actor or task. It has one parameter context with context.currentInput and context.parsedInputTableCsv. The parsedInputTableCsv are parsed data from CSV passed from keboola extractor. Each line is represent as object, where key is name of column.

input_schema.name: Input table record
input_schema.description: This field will be set from Keboola integration.

input_schema.name: Not using Metamorph
input_schema.description: If true, then Metamorph will not be used. Use only in specific cases if metamorph cannot be used for some reason. This option is not recommended and use more compute units.

input_schema.name: Scrape Bundles
input_schema.description: Scrape [Games, Books and Software] Bundles

input_schema.name: Proxy
input_schema.description: Proxy servers let you bypass website protections, avoid IP address blocking and view content for other countries. Try to use the proxy if you are experiencing timeout errors.

input_schema.name: Actor title
input_schema.description: The title of your actor

input_schema.name: Actor description
input_schema.description: What does your actor do? Describe it in a couple of sentences. Give examples if appropriate.

input_schema.name: Target website
input_schema.description: The website your actor is targeting

input_schema.name: Example READMEs
input_schema.description: Provide some quality Actor README to base yours on.

input_schema.name: Sample data
input_schema.description: A sample of your Actor's output in JSON format.

input_schema.name: OpenAI API key
input_schema.description: Your OpenAI API key

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: Can be main page URL or any category URLs. Article pages are found and enqueued from these.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of articles
input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Date from
input_schema.description: Only articles from this day to present will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or Number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

input_schema.name: Only new articles
input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.name: Debug
input_schema.description: Debug mode prints more logs, disables concurrency and other optimizations.

input_schema.name: Detailed
input_schema.description:
If checked, the scraper will obtain more detailed info for job offers by visit the details page of each job offer.

If un-checked, only the data from the listing page is extracted.

For details, please refer to https://apify.com/jurooravec/profesia-sk-scraper#output

input_schema.name: Search keywords (full-text search)
input_schema.description: Comma-separated list of keywords. If given, only entries matching the keywords will be retrieved (full-text search)

input_schema.name: Min salary
input_schema.description: If set, only entries offering this much or more will be extracted

input_schema.name: Min salary per hour/month
input_schema.description: Choose if the minimum salary is in per hour or per month format

input_schema.name: Type of employment
input_schema.description: If set, only entries with this employment filter will be extracted

input_schema.name: Remote vs On-site
input_schema.description: If set, only entries with this type of remote work filter will be extracted

input_schema.name: Last N days
input_schema.description: If set, only entries up to this much days old will be extracted. E.g. 7 = max 1 week old, 31 = max 1 month old, ...

input_schema.name: Count the matched job offers
input_schema.description: If checked, no data is extracted. Instead, the count of matched job offers is printed in the log.

input_schema.name: Extend Actor input from URL
input_schema.description:
Extend Actor input with a config from a URL.
For example, you can store your actor input in a source control, and import it here.
In case of a conflict (if a field is defined both in Actor input and in imported input) the Actor input overwrites the imported fields.
The URL is requested with GET method, and must point to a JSON file containing a single object (the config).
If you need to send a POST request or to modify the response further, use inputExtendFromFunction instead.

input_schema.name: Extend Actor input from custom function
input_schema.description:
Extend Actor input with a config defined by a custom function.
For example, you can store your actor input in a source control, and import it here.
In case of a conflict (if a field is defined both in Actor input and in imported input) the Actor input overwrites the imported fields.
The function must return an object (the config).

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: List of URLs to scrape.

input_schema.name: Start URLs from Dataset
input_schema.description:
Import URLs to scrape from an existing Dataset.
The dataset and the field to import from should be written as {datasetID}#{field}.
Example: datasetid123#url will take URLs from dataset datasetid123 from field url.

input_schema.name: Start URLs from custom function
input_schema.description: Import or generate URLs to scrape using a custom function.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: Include personal data
input_schema.description:
By default, fields that are potential personal data are censored. Toggle this option on to get the un-uncensored values.
WARNING: Turn this on ONLY if you have consent, legal basis for using the data, or at your own risk. Learn more

input_schema.name: Limit the number of requests
input_schema.description:
If set, only at most this many requests will be processed.
The count is determined from the RequestQueue that's used for the Actor run.
This means that if requestMaxEntries is set to 50, but the associated queue already handled 40 requests, then only 10 new requests will be handled.

input_schema.name: Transform requests
input_schema.description:
Freely transform the request object using a custom function.
If not set, the request will remain as is.

input_schema.name: Transform requests - Setup
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time initialization code before requestTransform.

input_schema.name: Transform requests - Teardown
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time teardown code after requestTransform.

input_schema.name: Filter requests
input_schema.description:
Decide which requests should be processed by using a custom function.
If not set, all requests will be included.
This is done after requestTransform.

input_schema.name: Filter requests - Setup
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time initialization code before requestFilter.

input_schema.name: Filter requests - Teardown
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time teardown code after requestFilter.

input_schema.name: RequestQueue ID
input_schema.description:
By default, requests are stored in the default request queue. Set this option if you want to use a non-default queue. Learn more
NOTE: RequestQueue name can only contain letters 'a' through 'z', the digits '0' through '9', and the hyphen ('-') but only in the middle of the string (e.g. 'my-value-1')

input_schema.name: Limit the number of scraped entries
input_schema.description:
If set, only at most this many entries will be scraped.
The count is determined from the Dataset that's used for the Actor run.
This means that if outputMaxEntries is set to 50, but the associated Dataset already has 40 items in it, then only 10 new entries will be saved.

input_schema.name: Rename dataset fields
input_schema.description:
Rename fields (columns) of the output data.
If not set, all fields will have their original names.
This is done before outputPickFields.
Keys can be nested, e.g. "someProp.value[0]". Nested path is resolved using Lodash.get().

input_schema.name: Pick dataset fields
input_schema.description:
Select a subset of fields of an entry that will be pushed to the dataset.
If not set, all fields on an entry will be pushed to the dataset.
This is done after outputRenameFields.
Keys can be nested, e.g. "someProp.value[0]". Nested path is resolved using Lodash.get().

input_schema.name: Transform entries
input_schema.description:
Freely transform the output data object using a custom function.
If not set, the data will remain as is.
This is done after outputPickFields and outputRenameFields.

input_schema.name: Transform entries - Setup
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time initialization code before outputTransform.

input_schema.name: Transform entries - Teardown
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time teardown code after outputTransform.

input_schema.name: Filter entries
input_schema.description:
Decide which scraped entries should be included in the output by using a custom function.
If not set, all scraped entries will be included.
This is done after outputPickFields, outputRenameFields, and outputTransform.

input_schema.name: Filter entries - Setup
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time initialization code before outputFilter.

input_schema.name: Filter entries - Teardown
input_schema.description: Use this if you need to run one-time teardown code after outputFilter.

input_schema.name: Dataset ID
input_schema.description:
By default, data is written to Default dataset. Set this option if you want to write data to non-default dataset. Learn more
NOTE: Dataset name can only contain letters 'a' through 'z', the digits '0' through '9', and the hyphen ('-') but only in the middle of the string (e.g. 'my-value-1')

input_schema.name: Cache ID
input_schema.description:
Set this option if you want to cache scraped entries in Apify's Key-value store.
This is useful for example when you want to scrape only NEW entries. In such case, you can use the outputFilter option to define a custom function to filter out entries already found in the cache. Learn more
NOTE: Cache name can only contain letters 'a' through 'z', the digits '0' through '9', and the hyphen ('-') but only in the middle of the string (e.g. 'my-value-1')

input_schema.name: Cache primary keys
input_schema.description:
Specify fields that uniquely identify entries (primary keys), so entries can be compared against the cache.
NOTE: If not set, the entries are hashed based on all fields

input_schema.name: Cache action on result
input_schema.description:
Specify whether scraped results should be added to, removed from, or overwrite the cache.
- add - Adds scraped results to the cache
- remove - Removes scraped results from the cache
- set - First clears all entries from the cache, then adds scraped results to the cache
NOTE: No action happens when this field is empty.

input_schema.name: maxRequestRetries
input_schema.description: Indicates how many times the request is retried if BasicCrawlerOptions.requestHandler fails.

input_schema.name: maxRequestsPerMinute
input_schema.description: The maximum number of requests per minute the crawler should run. We can pass any positive, non-zero integer.

input_schema.name: maxRequestsPerCrawl
input_schema.description:
Maximum number of pages that the crawler will open. The crawl will stop when this limit is reached.
NOTE: In cases of parallel crawling, the actual number of pages visited might be slightly higher than this value.

input_schema.name: minConcurrency
input_schema.description:
Sets the minimum concurrency (parallelism) for the crawl.
WARNING: If we set this value too high with respect to the available system memory and CPU, our crawler will run extremely slow or crash. If not sure, it's better to keep the default value and the concurrency will scale up automatically.

input_schema.name: maxConcurrency
input_schema.description: Sets the maximum concurrency (parallelism) for the crawl.

input_schema.name: navigationTimeoutSecs
input_schema.description: Timeout in which the HTTP request to the resource needs to finish, given in seconds.

input_schema.name: requestHandlerTimeoutSecs
input_schema.description: Timeout in which the function passed as BasicCrawlerOptions.requestHandler needs to finish, in seconds.

input_schema.name: keepAlive
input_schema.description: Allows to keep the crawler alive even if the RequestQueue gets empty. With keepAlive: true the crawler will keep running, waiting for more requests to come.

input_schema.name: ignoreSslErrors
input_schema.description: If set to true, SSL certificate errors will be ignored.

input_schema.name: additionalMimeTypes
input_schema.description: An array of MIME types you want the crawler to load and process. By default, only text/html and application/xhtml+xml MIME types are supported.

input_schema.name: suggestResponseEncoding
input_schema.description: By default this crawler will extract correct encoding from the HTTP response headers. There are some websites which use invalid headers. Those are encoded using the UTF-8 encoding. If those sites actually use a different encoding, the response will be corrupted. You can use suggestResponseEncoding to fall back to a certain encoding, if you know that your target website uses it. To force a certain encoding, disregarding the response headers, use forceResponseEncoding.

input_schema.name: forceResponseEncoding
input_schema.description: By default this crawler will extract correct encoding from the HTTP response headers. Use forceResponseEncoding to force a certain encoding, disregarding the response headers. To only provide a default for missing encodings, use suggestResponseEncoding.

input_schema.name: Batch requests
input_schema.description:
If set, multiple Requests will be handled by a single Actor instance.
Example: If set to 20, then up to 20 requests will be handled in a single "go", after which the actor instance will reset.
See Apify documentation.

input_schema.name: Wait (in seconds) between processing requests in a single batch
input_schema.description:
How long to wait between entries within a single batch.
Increase this value if you're using batching and you're sending requests to the scraped website too fast.
Example: If set to 1, then after each entry in a batch, wait 1 second before continuing.

input_schema.name: Log Level
input_schema.description: Select how detailed should be the logging.

input_schema.name: Error reporting dataset ID
input_schema.description:
Dataset ID to which errors should be captured.
Default: 'REPORTING'.
NOTE: Dataset name can only contain letters 'a' through 'z', the digits '0' through '9', and the hyphen ('-') but only in the middle of the string (e.g. 'my-value-1')

input_schema.name: Send errors to Sentry
input_schema.description:
Whether to report actor errors to telemetry such as Sentry.
This info is used by the author of this actor to identify broken integrations, and track down and fix issues.

input_schema.name: Metamorph actor ID - metamorph to another actor at the end
input_schema.description:
Use this option if you want to run another actor with the same dataset after this actor has finished (AKA metamorph into another actor). Learn more
New actor is identified by its ID, e.g. "apify/web-scraper".

input_schema.name: Metamorph actor build
input_schema.description: Tag or number of the target actor build to metamorph into (e.g. 'beta' or '1.2.345')

input_schema.name: Metamorph actor input
input_schema.description: Input object passed to the follow-up (metamorph) actor. Learn more

input_schema.name: Maximum number of articles
input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Date from
input_schema.description: Only articles from this day to present will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or Number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

input_schema.name: Only new articles
input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.description: Dataset of the ID to download the data from. If you set up a webhook, it will be posted in the default payload

input_schema.name: Fully-qualified table name
input_schema.description: Table name in the format DATABASE.SCHEMA.TABLENAME

input_schema.name: Connection username
input_schema.description: Your acount's username

input_schema.name: Account name
input_schema.description: Account name. You can get it from the url, it's usually a set of letters and is not the same as your username.

input_schema.name: Password
input_schema.description: Your account's password

input_schema.name: Database name
input_schema.description: Your database's name.

input_schema.name: Warehouse
input_schema.description: Supply your custom warehouse name if you want. The deault works fine as well.

input_schema.name: Stage
input_schema.description: Supply name of the stage where the file with data will be uploaded (with PUT). If you don't specify this, your table's default stage will be used.

input_schema.name: Flatten JSON
input_schema.description: If you select this option, instead of {a: {b: 1, c: [1, 2]}} you'll get {a.b: 1, a.c.0: 1, a.c.1: 2}

input_schema.name: Transform JSON key function
input_schema.description: Runs after flattening JSON. Enter body of a function that will transform JSON keys of dataset objecs. You have access to 'key' argument and must return a string. Example: 'return key.toLowerCase()'

input_schema.name: Transform JSON data function
input_schema.description: Runs after transforming keys. Enter the body of a function that will transform dataset objecs. You have access to 'value' argument that is a json object from dataset and must return a(n) (un)modified value. Example: value.name += '/'; return value

input_schema.name: Limit rows
input_schema.description: Limit the number of rows to be uploaded (e.g. for testing purposes on large datasets, because you have to wait for all your dataset to get transformed before pushing anything to the db). If you don't specify this, all rows will be uploaded.

input_schema.name: Overwrite table
input_schema.description: Whether to drop the table's data before pushing dataset data into it

input_schema.name: Database schema columns (SETTING THIS OPTION WILL DROP YOUR TABLE)
input_schema.description: In case your destination table has a schema incompatible with the dataset, you can provide a list of column names and their types, then the table will be synchronized according to your definitions by dropping and recreating the table. Key is the column name, value is the column type (as in SQL query, like VARCHAR). This is optional if your table already has the desired schema.

input_schema.name: Confirm data loss
input_schema.description: If you choose to synchronize your schema or overwrite previous data, check this checkbox to confirm that you agree to lose your previous data

input_schema.name: File upload retries
input_schema.description: How many times to retry uploading the file to Snowflake. This setting is useful because this last operation sometimes fails for large datasets due to snoflake's driver

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: How many items to extract from jlabaudio.com

input_schema.name: Extend Output Function
input_schema.description: Add or remove properties on the output object or omit the output returning null

input_schema.name: Extend Scraper Function
input_schema.description: Advanced function that allows you to extend the default scraper functionality, allowing you to manually perform actions on the page

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: Any data that you want to have available inside the Extend Output/Scraper Function

input_schema.name: Fetch HTML
input_schema.description: If you decide to fetch the HTML of the pages, it will take twice as long. Make sure to only enable this if needed

input_schema.description: Max concurrency to use

input_schema.name: Max request retries
input_schema.description: Set the max request retries

input_schema.description: Enable a more verbose logging to be able to understand what's happening during the scraping

input_schema.name: Weaviate Class
input_schema.description: A class describes a data object, such as in the form of a noun (e.g., Person, Product, Timezone) or a verb (e.g., Move, Buy, Eat). Classes are always written with a capital letter first. This helps in distinguishing classes from primitive data types when used in properties. For example, dataType: ["text"] means that a property is a text, whereas dataType: ["Text"] means that a property is a cross-reference type to a class named Text. Reference: https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate/config-refs/schema

input_schema.name: OpenAI API Token
input_schema.description: Open AI Api Token is used for Vector Embeddings

input_schema.name: Field Mappings
input_schema.description: Field Mapping between Dataset and Weaviate Class. datasetColumnName = Name of the column in the Apify Dataset. dbPropertyName = Name of property in Weaviate Class. isKeyColumn = Is this column the ID for the Weaviate row. isMetadata = is this a metadata column. If false then the column will be converted to vector embeddings.

input_schema.name: Erasmus Charter for Higher Education Code
Proxy Configuration
input_schema.description: Use either Apify proxies or your own.

input_schema.name: Debug Mode
input_schema.description: Check this field if you need to see debug logs.

input_schema.name: Start URLs
input_schema.description: Can be main page URL or any category URLs. Article pages are found and enqueued from these.

input_schema.name: Maximum number of articles
input_schema.description: Maximum number of valid articles scraped. The crawler will stop automatically after reaching this number.

input_schema.name: Date from
input_schema.description: Only articles from this day to present will be scraped. If empty, all articles will be scraped. Format is YYYY-MM-DD, e.g. 2019-12-31, or Number type e.g. 1 week or 20 days

input_schema.name: Only new articles
input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.name: Category URL
input_schema.description: Enter the URL of the category you want to scrape

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler. Proxy is important for Products Scraping. Try to use better proxies like Residential while scraping capterra.

input_schema.name: Max items
input_schema.description: How many items to extract from 310nutrition.com

input_schema.name: Extend Output Function
input_schema.description: Add or remove properties on the output object or omit the output returning null

input_schema.name: Extend Scraper Function
input_schema.description: Advanced function that allows you to extend the default scraper functionality, allowing you to manually perform actions on the page

input_schema.name: Custom data
input_schema.description: Any data that you want to have available inside the Extend Output/Scraper Function

input_schema.name: Fetch HTML
input_schema.description: If you decide to fetch the HTML of the pages, it will take twice as long. Make sure to only enable this if needed

input_schema.name: Max concurrency
input_schema.description: Max concurrency to use

input_schema.name: Max request retries
input_schema.description: Set the max request retries

input_schema.name: Debug Log
input_schema.description: Enable a more verbose logging to be able to understand what's happening during the scraping

input_schema.name: Don't store in dataset
input_schema.description: If set to true, the actor will not store the results in the default dataset. Useful when using alternative storage, like own database

input_schema.name: Postgres connection string for normalized data
input_schema.description: If set, actor will store normalized data in Postgres database in PG_DATA_TABLE and PG_DATA_PRICE_TABLE tables

input_schema.name: Postgres table name for product data
input_schema.description: Table name for storing product name, url, image, ...

input_schema.name: Postgres table name for price data
input_schema.description: Table name for storing price, original price, stock status, ...

input_schema.description: If true, will scrape only new articles each time you run it. All URLs you scraped are compared with saved ones. Scraped articles are saved in one dataset per each domain, datasets are named 'ARTICLES-SCRAPED-domain'

input_schema.name: Extend output function
input_schema.description: Function that takes a JQuery handle ($) as argument and returns data that will be merged with the default output

input_schema.name: Custom map function
input_schema.description: Function that takes each of the objects as argument and returns data that will be mapped by the function itself.

input_schema.name: Proxy configuration
input_schema.description: Select proxies to be used by your crawler.

input_schema.name: API key to Firebase
input_schema.description: Your API key to Firebase. It can be found in Firebase console under Project settings -> General -> Web API key.

input_schema.name: Auth domain to Firebase
input_schema.description: Your auth domain to Firebase. It can be found in Firebase console under Project settings -> Add app -> Web app -> Register app -> Code snippet -> authDomain.

input_schema.name: Project ID to Firebase
input_schema.description: Your project ID to Firebase. It can be found in Firebase console under Project settings -> General -> Project ID.

input_schema.name: Firestore collection ID
input_schema.description: Firestore collection ID to import data to. It can be found in Firebase console under Firestore Database -> Data. Ensure that the Firestore permissions are set to allow read and write. If the collection does not exist, it will be created.

input_schema.name: Dataset ID in Apify to import data from
input_schema.description: Dataset ID in Apify to import data from. It can be found in Apify console under Storage -> Datasets -> Dataset ID.

input_schema.name: Custom ID field
input_schema.description: Optional field name to use as a document ID in Firestore. If not provided, the document ID will be generated automatically. It is applied after the transform function. In case of duplicate IDs, the document will be overwritten. Read more in README.

input_schema.name: Transform function
input_schema.description: Optional transform function to modify data before import. For more info see README.
